qRhtsszTpHXzVe39NGdBBQ.text: Surprisingly delicious for what it is. I didn't expect much, but happened to be in the Venetian and jonesing for some noodles. Fair prices for Vegas, great food. Ok service. Only knocked off a star because they charge $6 for Thai Iced Tea, which costs almost nothing to make, and then would not offer refills, which is standard in most Thai places. For that price, I expect a refill. Overall though, no complaints about anything else, and I would visit again. The pot stickers were amazing.

y_PA-eom325MBYG8FDhbGw.text: On a recent business trip, decided to return to Noodle Asia in the Venetian Hotel.  Casual dining with nice atmosphere and reasonably priced for Las Vegas.  However, I do not recommend their "chicken" dishes.  I ordered Kung Pao Chicken (a.k.a. chicken with peanut).   (1) Sauce far too sweet (2) Too much sauce.  Chicken and peanuts floating in sauce (3) The most important is that the chicken was not real.  This is the so-called "rubberized" chicken, which is a highly processed product and not actual white or dark meat chicken.  Stay away!  Horrible.

7pj2MMVrEu_bUs0OMxxwdw.text: I was not expecting to find an Asian restaurant at the Venetian! I was pleasantly surprised to find this restaurant that didn't require a long wait (seated immediately in fact!), authentic food with Mandarin Chinese speaking servers. We were on a tight schedule so this was a good choice for us. I ordered a bowl of wonton noodle soup. It was filling and the broth was light and refreshing.

j1zkzrjspQvXwmiXSr1xBA.text: BBQ pork & duck noodle soup was just okay. The broth was a bit salty and they were skimpy on the meat. The Szechuan beef noodle soup wasn't any better. The broth had too much of a soy sauce taste and there were barely any vegetables.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ pork &amp; duck wonton noodle soup

hOx0Z4Hic3Sd3YgOdI2WjQ.text: Undoubtedly this is the worst Chinese restaurant in las Vegas... The Pho I ordered is absolutely horrendous.  The menu claim the beef is the high quality rare beef ribeye.  They r so full of shit!  The beef look and taste like its been there for weeks.... Their broth taste like its loaded with msg which is bad for the heart. I never had a bowl of Pho as bad as this... If u claim u can cook Pho then get the right chef that knows how to cook it right; if not,  then take it off the menu... Venetian casino doesn't deserve this kind of bad review. In addition,  the basil that was suppose to come with my Pho is completely rotten to the core... I was wondering how could u serve this trash to the customer knowingly that it was uneditable... I would never come back to this dump they call a restaurant and I would never recommend anybody to this place. It is absolutely an embarrassment to visit this establishment!!

3Tsb-uxck6BwG3cOeQnfNw.text: This is the place to go if you're craving Chinese food late at night in Vegas and are staying at or near the Venetian!!  My bf and I shared the red wontons and the szechwan beef noodle soup. I'm usually not a fan of wontons or sour-ish soups but both were pretty dang delicious. It had just the right amount of spiciness to really hit the spot! I'm sure it tastes even better after a long night of clubbing. I also tried some of my cousin's sausage fried rice and it was really good too! It's a little overpriced for Chinese food but hey, what isn't overpriced in a hotel in Vegas, right?  Another plus about this restaurant is that the service is quick! Our food came out really fast. So if you're in a hurry, this is an ideal place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. szechwan beef noodle soup
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. red wontons

z_LjHLgDe7Bw_VQ2GApLCA.text: Ate here a couple times during a long stay in Vegas.    It can be pretty pricey, esp for noodles, because you can typically get Pho for less than $10 at any normal restaurant...whether or not it is "Prime" pho.  The pho here is $16.95, but just remember, you're eating at the Venetian, so you can't expect dirt-cheap prices for anything...this is how they roll, so you can either roll with it, or roll yourself out to another eating establishment =p  The pho was very good tho, bigger than I expected, and the broth was pretty good.    The wonton soup and fried rice were pretty good also, and so was this spicy noodle dish, which I forget at the moment exactly what it was called.    Lines can be long, even late at night, but because you're in Vegas, you just gotta gamble and go when you're stomach wants you to go and see what happens.  Would definitely eat here again, esp if I'm staying in the hotel, just because it's so convenient.  I DID, however, have one encounter with beverage;  how do you run out of drinks? Granted, we got here after 10, but goodness, no Thai iced tea, chrysanthemum tea, OR Pepsi?! Come on!  Gotta stay stocked...people.  That's the only reason for the 3 star rating...if I come 3 more times and they have the drink I want, then I'll bump them back up.

YuOrVOQjuz6l6X3ogo_N0Q.text: My friend wanted some Asian food so we looked on Yelp and this was the closest place and had pretty good reviews. The first thing was it was hard to find because they are doing construction inside the casino. The restaurant is located in the back behind the construction--they needed better signage. Secondly, the place was packed so we had higher hopes for the place. I honestly thought the food was ok and did pacify our craving, but I was really turned off by the plastic utensils and paper plates...it almost felt like I was eating take-out in the restaurant. The service was also not that great. I know my friend wanted Asian food, but this is not the place I envisioned for us inside a casino. Almost felt like it should be part of a food court. The decor does make it feel like an asian diner.

DYnbdmd0JsgWodkpRkuq9Q.text: After a long day at a conference a steaming bowl of noodle soup sounded just right. I sat at the bar and ordered a Tsing Tao and edamame to start followed by chicken mushroom noodle soup. It was exactly what I was looking for and hit the spot! The broth needed a little more flavor but otherwise it was good. Nicely priced too for Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom chicken noodle!

r18QhxTQ3gbfcnoDd0Osjg.text: Pho was not salty and lots of meat in there.  Good vibe when you craving Asian noodle soup in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vWeQZD3QblBFjv1qPuH11A.text: Birthday brunch with my babes. My new favorite Asian place on the strip. Good Hong Kong style food. They have some dim sum entries and other great entires. Open late and the prices are reasonable for what you'd expect at the Venetian.   I personally love this place and they do a good job. I've grown up eating Hong Kong style food so I have a taste for it and know how it should be. This place is on point.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chow Fun beef noodle Hong Kong style. Done right. On point. At the Venetian Las Vegas. Lunch.

MQEwEWuYet12ajTEuxssNQ.text: This is good drunk food at its best. Pricey in the Venetian hotel but what do you expect of a place that's open till 3 AM and with decent service? Their beef chow fan is pretty good and greasy and perfect for drunkies. Their beef stew and wonton noodle dish was decent and we ordered the pork and preserved egg congee too. Even though we were four hungry slightly drunk Asian girls, we managed to finish almost all of it but we could have done one dish less.  Overall, nice people, expensive price tag for mediocre Chinese food but redeemed by the fact that they're open late and have the right amount of grease in the food :)

3c9f57spNGDHjwFMQqWw1Q.text: I really enjoyed my lunch combo of Mandarin duck / soy sauce chicken.  They were very authentic preparations, like Hong Kong / Singapore Street food.  Lots of bones, but that is how the dishes are made.  Very tasty and reasonable, especially compared to the nearby food court steam table stuff.  Some dishes get up there, but very few over $20, so not bad for right in a casino.

GoKORj_PKrN9yTTSgmBTbg.text: Great service! Meat was cooked perfectly because sometimes its just too "chewy".  Tomato rice was bomb though.  Shrimp Wok noodles was awesome!

Aj2A1gmkjK6oiupuhOYV-g.text: Ordered Szechan Beef Noodle and overall it's at the salty side.  Noodle: over-cooked and too soft. I would expect the noodle itself is more chewy and firm so it brings different texture to the food.  Beef: beef is stewed nicely for both two types of meat. No complain about it.  Soup: soy sauce based at the salty side. I can't finish the soup and still feel thirsty after drank a few cups of tea.

tDz_f2GFtqor4diZ1zxVBw.text: Not bad, it's a small restaurant amongst the casino and race and sports book area in the Venetian casino. They have a bar area and several tables, but overall, it's a small venue. We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table of 5. No biggie, but the number of tables limits the customers from doing what they do best in Vegas...eating. Unlike some of the other restaurants in a casino area, this one has some great views of the casino floor and the sports book tv's. So you get some entertainment as well. I got the roast pork and roast duck with rice combination. For a Chinese owned, Chinese cooked, Chinese restaurant, I was a bit disappointed at the roast duck. Not one of the best ones I've had. The roast pork was decent and the white rice...well it's hard to mess up white rice (unless you give me the crusty, burnt up ones that stick to side of the rice cooker) But no...I didn't get the crusty version. It was nice and flaky. yelp.com/biz_photos/_j2E... I'd probably get the fried rice next time. My compatriots in crime got the combination fried rice and they liked it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roast pork and roast duck with rice
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d2qMvFHMYNgJr8pLujWTwA.text: Las Vegas no longer offers prime rib for $1.  Restaurants on the Strips, specially, the ones in the hotels can be veeery expensive.  Overpriced due to high rent and location, I understand but I expect at least a decent quality of food.  Having said that the wonton soup was decent.  A good Chinese restaurant has to have a great fried rice.  On top of non flavorful rice it had three medium size shrimps...Service needs a lot of improvement.  If you don't want to drive 15 to 20 minutes for a great Chinese food, this place will have to do.  But then again, you have Panda express on the second floor.

W1LqREAd6y12eXDt3Y10ww.text: Sichuan beef noodle in soup is good, must try! Otherwise just average, don't order dim sum, it is disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IvvJx6E3zfGj6j5yDY64UA.text: For the price I am paying, I am very satisfied with their food. The Szechuan beef noodle soup is a must-try. It's medium spicy I liked it a lot ! My second time here and will definitely go back.

oFZ6XvhtqbK3AFkaoaKDdw.text: First time was alright, not memorable but ok. Yesterday I went was bad.  The portions are so tiny for the price they charge.  Do not buy order their wonton noodle.. 15.95$ they couldn't even fill up the bowl. The lamb chop appetizer $15.95 was 2 tiny pieces. Never again.

lDD_g-MRFw9AUL7HODIQHg.text: One of the better chinese restaurants on the strip that are both delish and affordable . I would recommend the fried rice , spicy cucumbers and beef noodles

xgBxvI82fY4UFsAW8CmcOQ.text: There's this thing that Asian people usually do when looking for a good Asian restaurant, and that's to look for other Asians eating there. At least, that's what my fiance and I did when we were looking for a place to eat. We were bleeding money in Vegas (like everyone else) and wanted to find a place that had decent prices for decent food on the Strip. So we ended up at Noodle Asia.  The prices are slightly higher than what we would pay in Chinatown Houston, at least for what we ordered. We got flat rice noodles with beef and Chinese sausage fried rice. Both pretty tasty in their own right. However, some of the other things on the menu were priced ridiculously.   I would come back again if I felt like I spent too much money the day before, especially if I just wanted to stay on the Strip. Also, being in the Venetian helps since it was by far my favorite hotel/casino.

rhGPlLeAEA2rzg3G0TNYpg.text: Poor food quality, poor service. Food didn't look fresh. Almost looked like reheated microwave stuff. :(

nfLZyn-9SCxGVQLnsEHLfg.text: Decided to have some soft noodles with shrimp, pork, calamari and vegetables.  The soup was tasty, but did need to be spiced up.  A hair was found in the fried rice dish which they quickly replaced and comped the plate.  This place is very busy and the food is usually pretty good.  Aside from the hair, it wasn't bad.

P90_2PoUlvbKF8FX05EDbQ.text: Noodle Asia is a great alternative to the heavy and fast food alternatives at The Venetian Hotel. Their food is fresh and flavorful. Excellent!!

9gE8IVVfO4mCuLAiM32i3g.text: Stopped here after a show and although I am a self proclaimed Asian noodle addict this place was an over the top joy. My wife is much more traditional Chinese food type so she went with the  safe shrimp fried rice. It was good.  I ordered the Shiu Mai with Pai Goo Noodle soup. It's all about the noodles  here.  They were just wonderful.   Service. just OK. They are busy and seem always busy but if real Asian noodles is what your after. ( and most of the other patrons were Asian.  Really a good sign ) This fits the bill. Reasonable price point especially in the heart of the Venetian resort.  Well worth your time

XtvL1SjSHvU4li8plgq4Pw.text: Fantastic food. Super quick, cheap and great quality. Favorite anything noodle or soup.

H893rRJEBDmJlIBCuMm5YA.text: I stopped by here during some night of the most recent Vegas trip, why can't I remember which night?! We probably got tired of Jet and decided to leave early. Our plan was to meet a couple friends at Venetian but Jon K and I were hungry so we decided to grab some noodles for a late night snack!   It took a few moments before anyone could help us or point us to a table, but it was pretty late so it's understandable. Our waiter came by with our menus immediately, he was also immediately ready to take our order! Way too fast, dude! Boyfriend & I shared the Szechuan Beef noodle soup, and our friend ordered the wonton noodle soup I think. He really liked his soup, and ours was delicious!! I was kinda worried bc it was supposed to be spicy, but it was just right! It warmed me up without making me reach for everyone's ice water! The beef was also super tender, yummy!   Price was a lil high, but hey, it's in the Venetian! And it wasn't anything more than you'd find at a pricey Asian place in any other city, so overall not too shabby! Definitely great for late night snack, it isn't too crowded and your food comes out pretty quick!

6-ttfD2sKhkreuAJq2ns8g.text: 3.5 stars. the bf LOVES this place and kept recommending it "it's so delicious; best, super authentic beef noodle soup; my friends and i all love it " but then again - what does he know?   service is average. food is expensive for chinese, but cheap for vegas. szechwan beef noodle soup is actually surprisingly awesome and i'd give that ONE dish a 5.... but all the rest is maybe a 2.5/ 3.... tea bags for the tea, sad grayish siu mai... and the kimchi is good, but $$$.   stick to the szechwan beef noodle soup!!  7/30 yelp challenge

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Umm...
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan beef noodles
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best kimchi

GM1EC1-E8cPs06q13mG2Wg.text: Very solid restaurant with delicious noodle soups. I've only eaten the noodle soups but they are damn good!

vqH-DgoAtGZAwODw38gzpQ.text: This is hands down the best meal we had on the Strip. We ordered Egg Flower soup which was great! The coconut juice was a whole coconut with a spoon to scrape off the cream inside; it was delicious! Ordered the Ta Lu Noodle soup and it was a huge bowl of awesome tasting food. But the best part of the whole experience was that the waiter was extremely knowledgeable and knew what to suggest. He helped my friends choose vegetarian dishes and they loved the food too.  Given that its inside Venetian, the food was very reasonably priced. The final check came down to 75 bucks including tip for 3 people. Loved every part of it.

vj23N4L4uK6GX6KTg8ZT9g.text: Good food, okay service.  If you're looking for good authentic Asian food in the Venetian in Vegas, this is your place.  However, like many of the very authentic Asian restaurants, the service was completely lacking.  Our waitress visited our table only twice, once to take our order and the second time to bring the bill.  Otherwise a server brought our food, and no stopped by again to ask if we needed anything else.   I tired to send back a plate because it wasn't what I wanted, and the hostess essentially told me "no", because they'd through the food away and it'd be wasted... so I just kept it and ate, but after a few more bites it wasn't all that bad after all  :-)  I guess what they lack in service they make up for in the food.

7N9XVtaG4qbDCVhrXqoxOQ.text: I really enjoy eating at this place every time I visit the Venetian and this time was no different.  There's a reason you see tons of Asians eating at a Chinese restaurant in a casino and that would include me. The place makes authentic Chinese food for higher than authentic prices. The service is also authentically curt but prompt, heh.  Even though the prices are sometimes more than double than what you would get in a cheap chinese restaurant, it is relatively inexpensive compared to other restaurants in the Venetian. The food also taste much better than the typical take-out.  I've had multiple noodle dishes from soups to stir-fry and have been impressed with the flavours of each. Standouts include the Szechuan beef stew and the duck soup. The appetizers are where the authenticity of the dishes is apparent as there are offerings unfamiliar to people who frequent the usual Chinese-American places.  My friend ordered a vegetarian rice dish which he enjoyed even though I made fun of his ordering a non-noodle dish at a noodle place.

AEXolR0rtsIoDaBDAIonwg.text: Husband ordered Mongolian Beef and I ordered Kung Pao Chicken. I tasted the Mongolian Beef and could not even mange to swallow it. Horrible flavor and texture. My Kung Pao Chicken was even worse. The rubbery texture was horrible and the watery sauce was unidentifiable. I will say that management was kind enough not to charge us. We left after having taken only 1 bite each.

Hkia64dWY59LuQ0EnbmJnQ.text: We came here on vacation excited for some good Asian cuisine. What we got (Kung Pao Chicken) was rubbery boiled/canned chicken with peanuts and watered down honey sauce. The rice was spongy and dry. We took one bite and sent the food back. I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

WUngVcmHnEquEY8c9fD-Xg.text: Maybe my expectation of food is so low in Vegas now, unless I'm at a famed restaurant, that Noodle Asia seemed to ourperform its peers by quite some!   Their Singapore noodles, made vegetarian, was quite good! Service wasn't great, but thankfully I didn't stay too long.

4Y7xYfRF9wzC9c4OROhnEQ.text: Love this place. Food is authentic Cantonese, not American Chinese fast food. Will definitely come here again!

uTM2MiWkfW3tOa2G8iMsog.text: I love the Venetian Hotel !  So many restaurants and Noodle Place did not disappoint on this fine day in January 2016!  Shrimp w black bean sauce was delicious. Beef stew soup with the tendons was a bit spicy but still amazing. Price is a little steep but hey, they have to pay rent too....

XSGWoQAHk8_Yf5VTwbSeqw.text: If you're looking for a quick lunch - it's a good place to go. My waitress was very cold, didn't speak more than 2 words, mostly just motioning to me. The runners were more engaging and friendly. That was nice to see.  Nothing made this an AMAZING experience but, food-wise, it was just what I wanted after walking around all morning.  I'd go back.

tSQrK6vwHVwIdMzUmx8Wtg.text: My favorite late night joint on the strip, hands down.   Why I love this place: 1. Convenient location 2. Open late 3. Home style cooking (even the chefs are Asian) 4. I've never had to wait to be seated 5. Fast and friendly service 6. Decent prices for being on the strip  I usually get the congee (rice porridge) with thousand year old egg. It warms the soul :)

tG9gaZvun-LM6O0GuobkzA.text: Love love love the food!! Tastes so good! Cures a hangover and service is fast and friendly!

GH8VanW1BFZ8p4Pu6pCplw.text: Horrible I ordered pineapple seafood rice was 90% dry rice with 4 small shrimp a few pieces of imitation crab and a few peppers and onions.  My husband had a noodle dish with chicken the noodles were pasty and flavorless overall. We didn't each much of either so I thought I would get the honey walnuts to snack on later.  They were so over done it was lie eating dry dust.

jTl7K_OkbPOMRjHnFlKk0Q.text: If I could just rate the service I would give them 4 stars but the food left much to be desired. So much so that most of it was left on the table. I wouldn't recommend ordering any chicken dishes as the chicken had a strange taste.

mxJAYqpg20Ds-TCy74X5Rg.text: Great lunch with my daughters. Just off the casino floor in the Venetian. Dumplings, noodles and duck. All delish. Service was quick and friendly. If we were here longer we'd definitely go back.  Thanks for tour great service and food to feed these hungry travelers!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

44gfcaKdBaHEOT9a7z9NxQ.text: Poor service and the food was only so-so. They were out of porridge, which is what they're known for and what the majority of our group was looking forward to. Other food was basic mass-produced Asian food. Because we had a group larger than six, tip was automatically included, so the waitress realized she didn't have to provide a single ounce of good service to earn her tip. We never saw her again after putting our order in. We actually had to track down a different employee to close out our tabs and box up our leftovers.  While you can only expect so much from a Vegas casino restaurant at 2 am, that's no excuse to half-@ss the service and food.

qr_T6y-EVQ39QCcGrLVzdg.text: When ever I'm feeling down wether that's from a long night out or a hangover. This is my place to make be feel better. The noodles are done well and the beef in my soup was delicious so tender and full of flavor it melted in my mouth. The service was decent nothing to rave about the tea's they also have on hand is great I had the oolong is always my favorite. This place really is a hidden gem and I know good noodles I'm from Monterey Park lol

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the best soup I&#39;ve had. Cures hangovers and sickness at least in my opinion lol

PwHj7Up1FTEVeii-DBxV5g.text: The wok tossed steak with garlic and basil tomato onion fried rice is so good. I think that they added ketchup, onions, and tomatoes in the fried rice making it extra delicious! For dessert we got the mango pudding. It does not sound awesome but one bite into it...surprise! There are bits of fresh mango in it and it's extra tasty!   Plenty of tables available and we didn't have to wait :)

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh mango pudding
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak with fried rice

nRJeVM3lwW_02UQOhbgMeQ.text: The best thing at Noodle Asia is definitely their Beef Noodle Soup (noodle + soup). I've been there a few times each trip when I visited Vegas, my friends always wanted some comfort food other than pho. I'm not a Beef Noodle fan in general, but their Beef Noodle Soup is on point if you can handle the salty-ness. I would not recommend finishing that bowl of soup, only if you are looking to get higher blood pressure, however, the noodles and beef are really good.   There's always a short line but it moves pretty fast!   2017011

fM3Fc3yCRY-1wkIyHvtwhQ.text: This is my worst noodle place in my life. Poor service, food is not tasty as i was expecting. Everything is super oily including lamb chop. Place is crowded because its inside Venetian. Poor service and awe-full food.

K_ps4Da_fW4N0NGwcpJF7Q.text: This place is wack, the pho is meh. They claim they have superior beef broth in their pho, rest assured it's not. I've had better broth out of a can from Safeway.   The server messed up my order too, I asked for no tripe and what do I get.... tripe.   Ordered the wings, like super salty and just not good.   Service was rushed but the food did come out very fast. All in all I wouldn't come back next time I'm here.

ELLLDcLm3P65KSX2DuQ-XA.text: FOOD - Sauteed Chicken With Broccoli: the chicken was tender but lacked flavor. The Chinese broccoli was a little more crunchier than I like. I was not liking this dish in my drunken state. lol. 2.75/5  - Boneless Chicken Breast Congee: I didn't like my dish so my friend shared her congee with me. It was amazing! It was probably one of the best congee I've ever had. She saved me from a disappointing dining experience. 5/5  SERVICE Fast and fair. 3.5/5  FINAL THOUGHTS I would come back for more congee or to try other dishes. It's overpriced Chinese food but, hey, it's Vegas. It wasn't outrageously expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boneless chicken congee in front and sautéed chicken and broccoli in the back

3DXfrOiZM8NTlTSS8Gv3xQ.text: This is a cute little resturant inside of the Venetian hotel that I found on my way to Tao nightclub. They had an excellent variety of food and it wasen't too packed so my family and I were seated right way.   I ordered the shrimp shumai with the chinese broccoli in garlic sauce.This was pretty delicious but i must admit way over priced.   The only downside I would say is the service. We were seated at the very back of the resturant and it took me waving my hands like a manaic for someone to place our orders or even refill our drinks, i was a little disappointed in that. Other than that its ok place if you're craving some good Chinese food.

RX13Yc-G3OZCzQhyA1ABgQ.text: Best on the strip...  can't get any closer to Asian Hong Kong street food!  I love the dim sum pot stickers and wonton soup

8IE-BkxXCQAEl4mK6cE23g.text: Very mediocre Chinese-style noodles and rice place. I honestly did not expect to see a place like this inside a casino floor (maybe in Atlantic City where I can get comp at the noodle bar).  Anyways, it's semi-authentic, quick, and overpriced, but you'll save a trip going to the Vegas Chinatown where the food is only marginally better.

AcnyqKcjObJZcRjC4sBocw.text: Went around 11:00PM on Saturday. Service was actually very fast. Soup was watered down and didn't have hardly any flavor. We ordered the won ton noodle soup and crab rangoons for a quick meal. It's good for convenience but definitely not the best food I've had.

0-LHBJ29_rQb6Qf4VJhrOg.text: Love this place! The shrimp and chive dumplings are tasty and I highly recommend the wok tossed diced steak with fried rice. The meat tastes like butta, Baby! I'm not a fan of tomatoes but the garlic and basil tomato onion fried rice is sooooo good! My date had the Singapore mei fen and it was great. I've had the potstickers and chicken wings on another occasion and would order those items again. Everything is amazing and you can watch the games at the sports book.

YtBlmg5NhggvLUn2gIByNw.text: This restaurant has a view of all the giant screens of the sports book. The food here is decent and is a nice place to have a little Chinese food after a night of drinking and partying.  I've ordered the Work Won Ton Soup, and I was expecting something fancy. It's just regular Won Ton Soup with some Char Siu, Chicken, and Shrimp thrown into the soup. Nothing special for a $20 bowl of dumplings! Where I'm from, a bowl like that would cost $5.   I would still come back to this restaurant even though the food isn't the best. I like the view of all the sports channels and I usually stay at the Venetian during my stays.   Don't come here expecting anything particular, and enjoy the hot food with a stunning view.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C0mB7z_NRvdQ3nPEeNdh1Q.text: We love the Venetian and one of the reasons is the great selection of food, from cheap eats to wow, did I just spend 500$.  Wasabi is great. It is located in the one of the food courts. The service is fast, the items all hot and fresh and the service perfect. You will get a lot for your money and it is super tasty. It is a great choice for lunch or a late night snack.

vxLt3LYlBAqebp1o3sww8g.text: NOT THE BEST BUT not bad for a Chinese restaurant on the Strip. For a reasonable price, you will find a good variety of Chinese dishes offered (and even better, they open until 3am).  The main problem we had with the restaurant was how we were charged extra for a side order. To explain, my dad ordered a beef stew noodle ($14) that was a reasonable portion, but the noodle-to-beef ratio was off so we ordered a side of beef.   I was shocked when the bill came and the small side of beef stew was $20. Whoa mama wtf is disssss!! We even tried to look on the menu but nowhere did it say beef stew by itself was $20, it seem like we were paying for a'la carte. The side was absolutely not $20 (perhaps $10 for a small dish).  Despite the food being decent, I'm doubtful about coming in again if I'm charged an unreasonable price for something that's not an entree.  TL;DR, good food and opened long but BEWARE of prices for sides or additional add-ons.

Ar_d-FMTq0NCPjsHAFAI-Q.text: As you can tell by my picture, only the iced tea was good.  I've never had Szechwan Beef Noodle Soup, so it's hard to say if I'm simply not a fan of it or if it was just not done well. The noodles were extra soggy and the 'beef' was all fat. I should've trusted all you fellow yelpers and NOT ordered this. Lesson learned.  I will say, the woman who rang me up was nice and, as previously mentioned, their chrysanthemum tea is good ($4+).

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jediO2ABpysy6LrttnVF_Q.text: Blah.  This is Vegas, and it's inside the Venetian for good sakes.  Plain decor that looks like it could be an old diner.  C'mon.  Pics on the website look nice, but they must be an artist rendered drawing of the place -- it looked nothing like it.  Fair prices, and simple service are the highlights.  1.  Fried Chicken Potstickers ($8.95) -- Edible, but very thick dough gave it the wrong consistency.  (3.0 stars)  2.  Broccoli with Oyster Sauce ($9.95) -- This was actually good, best of the night.  (4.0 stars)  3.  Soft fried noodle with chicken ($13.95) -- Boring and no taste.  Chicken was odd.  (2.0 stars)  I don't get what others who liked it see.  Disappointing.

arSDp1DGw3mM-LsS93e6eg.text: Find a hair in the fried rice, make me SICK! Poor service, ask me 18% tips before I pay. I never see it before.

VFSV5gdDlHPHyEylN2HS7Q.text: I really don't understand the mixed ratings for this place. We liked this place so much that we ate here twice on your little 2.5 day trip. We stayed at the Venetian so we were looking for something to eat nearby. We got lucky and found Noodle Asia on the casino floor. We had the won ton soup and Singapore noodles. I loved the noodles - they are spicy though. Service is average but food is good!

cPnH6pW15vkMfPK7wi0dRg.text: Very impressed with our food and service! Didn't think we could find authentic tasting noodle soups and rice places here in the hotel but I was wrong! We ordered pho and wonton soup, MIL and and aunts ordered rice plates and fried rice... Yum! All were good! Would def come back during our future trips. So happy we found a good Chinese restaurant at our favorite hotel in Vegas.

sdPHe-7oa655x_JQVv3YqA.text: Gross, tasteless, not good price value, and bad portions. Plate of soggy and insipid noodles with almost no veggies, and the duck and BBQ rice plate was basically duck bones and hard, rubbery pork fat on so-so tasting rice. Definitely not worth it, avoid at all costs.

80RQX3z2IZ33wmsCcFn7yw.text: They seem to like to put hoisin sauce on everything which makes it sweet and salty.  I ordered roast pork and duck on rice and an order of soy sauce chicken.  The roast pork is ok but the duck and chicken's texture is weird. Almost like they were re-fried to make it crispy. The hoisin sauce is just out of place.  The curry pineapple seafood fried rice is pretty good. The rice is dry and the curry's aroma was apparent.  The black chicken soup is also decent. It is a good size enough for two.

AoCJUL4Ecul9G-G7dIofOQ.text: This restaurant is right in the casino and is very affordable. Service was fine but all the food - meh

OJvrI9UrXQ46kSmwpvKvHQ.text: Only had the szechuan beef noodle soup.  I wish I was able to try more but the noodle soup was very very good.  One of the best Spicy beef noodle soups I've had.    I had a couple large chunks of fat in mine which I scooped out but other than that, great bowl of noodles.  Only downfall is that it was $14 for the bowl.    This would definitely make for a good hangover meal.

96ZsHdM9O4HDe8rDHAT0zw.text: Absolutely TERRIBLE...just don't waste your time or money, you are better off eating a bag of chips. I have this one chick's number saved in my phone as "you a fool if you answer" and I can honestly say you a fool if you go to this craptastic excuse for a restaurant.

o0ZK6Ey7hpBbtH4O43ZoGw.text: I've never been a fan of Chinese food, but my friends wanted to eat here. Super greasy, salty and unhealthy. I felt so gross after eating the noodles because it was super greasy. We ordered soup, but it was pretty nasty. Customer service was pretty terrible. I kept on drinking water because of how salty the food was.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hHA_yvgX5XguCGrgkNUewA.text: I always come here when I come to Vegas! The food has a lot of flavor compared to the cheap Chinese imitation you see so many in Vegas!

b2pE8U8ejvzeJkgAQjzHDQ.text: Some people may really love this place.  I was disappointed when I ordered mushroom chicken and ginger soup.  It was a cup not a bowl for about 12.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ddSOgCGDJW2B5zWMKzUU3g.text: BEST authentic noodles I have ever had.  All noodles are made fresh daily and majority of their clientele is actually Chinese.  I always start off with a bowl of the hot and sour soup followed by the beef rice noodles and occasionally some sake.  The portions are huge and can be split into two meals.  I have never left Noodle Asia disappointed.  I always make it a priority to dine here every time I am in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EdHS6c2iqCD0UV1GYBfpng.text: Classic authentic Chinese noodle restaurant. Ordered the XO hand made noodles with pork and vegetables. The noodles were soft and seared with a spicy garlic oyster sauce style and was great. Will order again. The menu is straight forward with a selection of 20-25 different entries. Service was decent but the value for food versus the size of the food portion could of been better. A bit pricy for Chinese food.

scdz8Z8TnF3DegcJcbhVCQ.text: Service was really good, but the food is something you can get at your local Chinese restaurant with the exception of the prime location after a long nights of gambling this is not where winners come to eat, this is where you come to eat after you lose, and you get slapped with a hefty bill at the end.... also they charge $4.00 for hot tea most Chinese restaurants don't

RZWYDrgfLhhqr07648awTA.text: Very poor quality food we ate there today everything was very bland tasting. Fried rice is something you would get out of a cafe zero flavor and nothing fried about it. Both dishes pork stir fry and beef and broccoli was extra Greasy. All in all waste of money and food was poor.

gCHjUy3ITFzLMXvDjwK7gg.text: 1 star is way too overrated for this place! Don't ever go there! We been literally wait outside of the restaurant for 10+ mins with no one greeting us or give us a head up. they overcharge you 15 bucks for a not even authentic Chinese noodles. The food is far from making you full. And the waitress didn't even talk to us when she waits our table. We are from Sichuan province china. We feel ashamed that this restaurant brand their noodles in name of our hometown and with such horrible customers service. I apologize as a Chinese for how they treated our friends from all over the world in Vegas!  ,,,,,,,,after i wrote this review, someone called Wei C messaged me privately and said all bad curse words to me. I'm not sure if he is related to this restaurant but his location is LV. OMG.

hMF6Qt3xc6lk89QbDfy1Yw.text: Love this place. Came here back in 2012 and couldn't remember the name. The singapore noodles were great! Tonight I'm trying the Lo Mein with beef.   One of the main reasons this place is so cool, is because it's open until 3am!

3MmWZR5L2LrwFPqeAqouLw.text: I want to give it zero. No service is fine, their problem is rude service. We waited at the table for 10 min without any water served. When asking a manager-looked waitress, she said we are busy busy busy, you just wait if you already asked for it. She felt deeply bothered by us. No response nor water whatsoever after another 10 min. Food is too much MSG. I wonder when they will close-- that's what they are doomed for.

DGf6clAMzh5y0Pj4MVHn7g.text: When I got to Las Vegas I was feeling a little under the weather. When I feel that way I always crave soup. At Noodle Asia I ordered a large vegetable noodle soup with fried tofu. It had a great variety of exotic mushrooms and veggies in a delicate broth. The noodles had a big, complex flavor. I couldn't get enough and ate until I was too full. Despite that, I had left overs to eat later that night in the hotel room. I thought the menu had something for everyone, the food was good, and the price was reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U7rZIis9s_fZfppPQORKBg.text: i will always have to come here at least once every time i visit Vegas! an alternative for drunk late night eating steak & eggs! it's not the fanciest place so don't expect a whole lot. the prices are a bit over priced for a chinese place but its Vegas!  +duck, yummm-o +fried rice, yummmy! +soups, mouth is watering!

Cvka1n9Ojz7c-0GhcKqRuA.text: Let's just put it this way, I had the fried rice two different times over the course of 4 days.  Definitely the best fried rice I've ever had.  Also, this place is very reasonably priced for Vegas and the dishes are big enough to share.  I highly recommend it!  Someone else said they ate there at 3AM.  I definitely walked by at 1AM and they were closed...otherwise I might have eaten there 3 times.  :)  So yeah, if you're staying at the Venetian, this place is worth a taste.

gChVyPYEZpptpycU3O4hpQ.text: This place was pretty good. We were walking around and some of us wanted Asian food. This is the place especially when you want some quick bite to eat.

fCaCPV1eCSOd9sa4h_b4Qg.text: Very expensive but very good Chinese food. The service is fast and friendly. The food is cooked immediately and is out in minutes. On a slow day, you can see the chefs watching you eat just to make sure they didnt screw it up. If you're willing to spend the extra dough, then go here. The lines can get long though, but they move people in and out rather quick.

U7PfG35rlTRA2rt2o27DEA.text: Good chinese food...pretty authentic.  It's expensive considering you're not paying for presentation or ambiance.  The service is very friendly and the food comes out fast.

a3nnUULC7jKkzuQn0ugG7A.text: We had late lunch, around 3 pm, at Noodle Asia.  Reasonable prices. Authentic chinese food.  Good hargow and lo mein.  They just need to teach the busser to ask first if we are done with our dishes before he decides to take them away.  Saying "excuse me" would also be nice.  Food was good though so yeah, I can eat here again.

Lddmudryoq7VtTfoMLaAdw.text: One thing I Miss about LA is Chinatown and the places that serve fresh noodles. Noodle Asia is a little more upscale but it's got great selection. It's located at the Venetian. But not at the best location. Right next to the Race and Sports book, they got one of them there Chinese places. Actually this restaurant houses some of the best fresh noodle makers here. So I'm here enough times when my family comes into town. Won Ton soup. Large steaming bowl of freshly made won tons. And they're BIG! Red Won Tons.... Spicy...Not for white people Large cantonese BBQ plate Yea I LOVE DUCK --- bbq pork is fresh and doesn't look like it's been sitting. Soy sauce chicken...well it's hard to really f*ck up soy sauce chicken. Pot stickers are fresh! The Sui Mai and Har Gow are fresh.....popping flavors. Night Market Fried Rice --- YUMMY! XO Shrimp Lai Fen --- SPICY and Yummy!  Well watch out --- if you don't like thick noodles --- make sure you watch what you get. Ask the server.  But overall --- service is efficient and there are actually asian people working and not mexican in the kitchen....

A816JEUKC7cBihtZEgeq8w.text: totally hidden gem!  Best Moo Shoe Pork ever....came wrapped in the pancakes and not a single pancake broke!  I'm sold!

-Nc4mBeTMajb4A2VIHjMeA.text: Located in the Venetian Hotel, Noodle Asia has a fabulous assortment of noodle dishes, dimsum, vegetarian specialties, rice and congee dishes and soups. They have a great choice of soups, such as BBQ pork and roast duck noodles in broth, Singapore vermicelli, shrimp fried rice as well as other fried noodle specialties with vegetable, seafood, beef and chicken. My favorites are the Szechwan Beef Soup and the Spicy Ying Nan Rice Noodle. The atmosphere is casual and the service is quick and courteous. It was so good that we ate there 2 days in a row.

3IFSEfAYRZCyw00wcRSKBQ.text: it's a bit pricey for chinese food....wait, heck. i'm in vegas. most things ARE pricey.   their yang chow fried rice, gyozas, chinese broccoli, and soup noodles are good eats. try those if you're hungry or if you need to refuel yourself before you lose your shorts at the craps table.

cBkzyB4LHjjqtaZPbLVJ_A.text: good and interesting chinese food in the venetian. the restaurant is in the middle of the casino floor, so there isn't much in the way of ambiance or privacy. the service is a little slow - our food came out well before our drinks.   we had potstickers, fried rice, and a spicy noodle soup for lunch. all of them were tasty, and that spicy soup definitely cleared my sinuses. i thought it was a good sign that there so many asian people eating in the restaurant.  we try to visit new restaurants every time we go to vegas, but i might be back to noodle asia for more.

DjUHYkukpW0ofb0pIU_YkA.text: Not bad spot for some late night munchies. This place is pretty pricey for some Asian food, but what isn't in the Venetian. Thanks to the reviews on Yelp I went with the Szechuan beef noodle soup. The broth on that was on point, but DAMN for $17?!?! Yeah I would stop by again to put something in the stomach when one may have in taken one to many drinks.

nrujLTbaBoPMXjBnXvmuqg.text: Im a fan of good chinese. i must say the wonton soup was loaded with big fat wontons 8 of them and the pan fried noode dish with chicken was awesome.. i went twice.. Worth every penny!

6VJg1ZV1z7j0hb-fG55MzA.text: here's a quick summary: over-priced and under-flavored.   i would have never come here if i weren't an asian staying at venetian, did have a rental car to venture out, or weren't struck with an asian food craving.

uVnIrwqrpt6NqYrWC1tB1Q.text: Tried this place where most places were closed.  This place opened till like 3 AM. Anyway, I tried the duck and bbq pork over rice and my husband tried the fried noodle.  I was expecting the worst because the place didn't look too inviting.  Boy... was I wrong.  The food were good. They were better than decent. The service was mediocre but better than what I expected.  I would give it another try when I am in town.

tQOLPCpP2hn4J-a0zJVf0A.text: Everytime I have come to Vegas, I always eat here. Their food is fast and good! I'm Chinese so I know! Just a little overpriced considering it's Chinese food.

lJpDPTg6i3e4EBXUz1y4bA.text: This place is a RIP-OFF.  I don't mind paying for food even when pricey but it's just not right that they served me rice water for $12.    I ordered the Pork and Preserved Egg Congi () to go.  When I got back to my hotel room, there was nothing in the container but the milky rice water - no rice, no egg, no pork.  A RIP-OFF.  Stay away from this place.

pQ5yKdl3XbvQiL_Bqau-Gw.text: Update:  Went back on 12.1.07 because my family had to have Wonton soup. Service was a bit better, portions was just ok considering the price of the soup $11 for a bowl. I guess it's the price of convenience. The wait staff was a mix up. I found the bus boys to offer much better service than the waiters. My only gripe this time was they put a crap load of MSG in the noodles. 30 minutes after I had my meal, my stomach was acting up the rest of the night.  It was ok. I won't even complain about the price because you're in the Venetian afterall but the service was slow and the waitstaff was rude unfortunately.

z0OxJpP93pkMz0jGjvoygQ.text: One of the best Asian comfort food in Las Vegas, and when I mean comfort food, I mean it in a sense that when you have lost all your money at the black jack table, you want something to comfort you.  Ok enough about my bad luck in gambling and more about Asia Noodle House.  For starters, the dim sum is always good, order any of them!  My favorite dish to order is duck and bbq pork over rice.  The duck's skin is always crunchy and the bbq pork is tender and sweet.  I also tried the duck and bbq pork over noodle, but I prefer the rice instead.

CB2Me1MIVLHyIn2Q83n3Yw.text: Noodle Asia is like a fast food court ramen shop tucked into a corner of the Venetian casino floor -- seems like it was placed there as an afterthought by the Venetian management to accomodate (take advantage of) all of the Asian gamblers.  It is completely open to the casino floor so it doesn't feel like a place where you can have a leisurely relaxing meal.  We had the red wontons, roast duck noodle soup and the pork chop noodle soup.  The wontons were a pricey appetizer, the soup broths were watery & bland, and the fried pork chop in my bowl of noodles was tough and dry.  Better noodle options can be found off the Strip on Spring Mountain Road.

wijvdsBGJCeihdQWtIknIA.text: What a ripoff! I thought that this classy place in the Venetian with astronomical prices for Chinese food might at least be good, but I had what was one of the most expensive and worst bowls of rice porridge here.   For $11 a bowl, I expect an incredible pork and preserved egg porridge. What I got: Watery flavorless porridge with about 1/4 of preserved egg and some stewed pork. You'd think at this price, one would get a whole preserved egg. Seriously stingy.  The pork was good, that's why it even has any stars.

NCo9RVNoBtXWaJYgpIgQHg.text: Everytime I come to Vegas, this is one of the places I stop by for their Beef Noodle soup.  The beef was nice square tender, no tendent and weird fats, noodles and soup flavor was out of the world.  Noodles and soup is still good, but their meat quality dropped by a lot.  It looks like 2nd tier meats from the meat rejection facility.  I one starred at first because I was furious while picking out all the meat, but I thought that was unfair to the resturant entire because of a meat downgrade, so I went to 3 stars... then my wifes food came out, and fried rice looked like porrage on one side and again, the beef on it was just plain rubbish, so it went down to 2 stars.  The 2 was for the service staff, they spoke Chinese and were always friendly.

-LbjMOh9P8A_yjrqFlL9FA.text: After a disastrous poker session at the poker room I decided to get some of my losses back in noodle form. It was 11 PM and I needed something to keep me full until I decide to quit my dreams of becoming a professional poker player and go to sleep.   I decided on the Si Jiu Beef Noodles. It had marinated beef, pan fried noodles, and veggies. The waiter said it was normally very spicy so I decided to order it mild since I sweat like crazy with spicy food. Unfortunately it was so mild that I didn't taste any of the spiciness at all. What I did taste was pain from the fresh pan fried noodle center. This was a dish to be eaten slowly! I ended up burning my mouth a little but I needed to get back in to the action.  Pro-tip: If you play poker, talk to the poker room boss for a food voucher.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Si jiu beef noodles

XCCs1UDv1B9OT7jnUogxuw.text: I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant, other than ok quality food with a high price for what it is. Surprisingly, the two noodle dishes we ordered were actually very good. I had Szechuan-style Beef noodle soup, which can be had for around seven dollars in California, but was around 13 dollars here. The noodles were a little weird, but the beef and soup were so delicious. The beef was actually very good quality with quite a bit of fat (which is apparently the correct style for this noodle soup). I gobbled it up. My dining mate had BBQ pork and duck noodle soup, which I wasn't particularly a fan of, but she said it was good (particularly the quality of the meats).  The food itself was potentially of five-star quality for one of those quick sit and go restaurants in Vegas, but considering that it's about double the price and not THAT higher quality, I can only give it four stars.

XaLCkhlsMe5d4RqMalzgkA.text: Food was below eating standards. The chicken and the beef were like chewing on rubber bands. the beef did not appear to be cooked all the way through   The service was rushed and not personal at all of our food was brought out at separate times   I would not recommend this place at all unless you like being dissatisfied wasting money and unsure if your going to end up sick later in the day on your vacation

xKUYHLThJ6axuwZKygQ2Iw.text: Extremely rude service.  The waiter practically threw the dishes of food on our table.  The food came before we had plates or silverware placed on the table.  We asked for plates and the waiter snarled that they were coming. When we asked for refills on our drinks, we were ignored.  Staff was disorganized and had no customer service skills.  Our complaints about the service were dismissed by the server and manager.  No apologies from anyone.  This establishment deserves no stars.

MVRXJm3ln0usiyZi1K0gOA.text: I ordered traditional mushroom chicken noodle. The soup tastes just like water and the there is no flavor in the noodles. Will never come back again.

QKdcEs4jsaB4lO3g-WsiEQ.text: This is a good place for a quick meal. Service was very quick and courteous. I didn't like the fact my soup came out with everyone's entree (versus first and then serve all entrees together) but I am told by my friend who is Chinese that is how they serve the food. Good food at a fair price. Perfect place when you want something tangible but quick.

cjMmjytX0rkiQWF343oNkw.text: Simple and delicious! Great noodle soup and good variety of choices after gambling. Servers speak Chinese so good for my Chinese parents :D would def come back! Downside is it takes quite awhile for the food to come when the place is packed.

LWKZAGqg_cICKhci2JhDNg.text: I had both the szechuan beef soup and the bbq pork and duck soup and both were absolutely amazing. I wish I had a place even REMOTELY like this in Denver! Super busy place, so expect a wait during lunch time! There was a line out the door every day I walked past it during lunch. This place is another on my do-not-miss in Vegas!

zToaNv5DOldm2QyMJsmk0g.text: It's OK. I came here because my coworker was sick and all she wanted to eat while we were in Vegas was noodle soup. Such a waste of a Vegas trip when I wanted to go try the new Caesar's buffet. But whatever.   I ordered the pai goo noodles, which were fine. The broth was a little on the bland side, but there was a generous amount of both noodles and pork. The lamb chops were super disappointing. It had been fried, which was not in the description at all, and I could barely taste the lamb. And it was like $10! So not worth it.  My coworker ordered some spicy noodle soup dish, which she mostly finished. But it seemed that it wasn't very spicy because she piled so much extra chili sauce into it.   Also, based on the speed of the service and the way our dishes looked, it seems like  the base is the same for everything and they just pile on different toppings.

UPVfZHeS0m410h2q-x32ag.text: 4 stars for the Beef Noodle Soup. Minus 1 star for service.  FOOD (4/5): - Chicken Noodle Soup: Organic chicken with soup, goji and noodles-- can't go too wrong. The broth was clear, hot and very qing. The chicken wasn't very flavorful, but that's what I expected from this type of soup.  We asked for extra noodles, which was an additional $3.  ($13 + $3 for extra noodles) - Beef Noodle Soup:  Very good!  Definitely the best part of the meal was eating a hot bowl of beef noodle soup filled with steamy broth, niu rou and the tendon.  It was cooked very well and the noodles were cooked al dente. I think they gave some of the sour veggies on top, which was yummy as well.  ($13) - Pho:  I didn't try it, but the price was a whopping $15-17! (I forget the exact price.)  SERVICE (3/5):  I'm a little surprised that Noodle Asia had a hostess who didn't know a lick of English. She had asked us to clear some space in the front and she said, "Back to go."  We didn't understand what she wanted and she seemed very flustered and angry (at herself?).  When a few people came to the front to ask how long the wait was, she didn't seem like she wanted to answer because they had asked in English.  The service in the restaurant wasn't too great either-- it was exactly what I had expected from a Chinese restaurant. However, since we were paying an arm and a leg for something that typically costs $6-8 in California, and since we were in Las Vegas, I was expecting better service.  At least some refill on tea and water... but we didn't get any of that type of service, and we got the same "rushed, stony-faced, no 'thank you'" service that we got at Sam Woo (in Chinatown). Haha.  I would still come back though. The venue and service are nothing to write home about, but the beef noodle soup definitely hit the spot for me.  WAIT:  We wanted for about 20 minutes and there were about 7 parties ahead of us. The good thing is that the line moved decently fast-- people get their noodles and dishes quickly, chomp it down, and then leave for more Vegas fun.  When I called at 12 pm, the person who picked up the phone said the wait was 1 hour.  O_O    VENUE:  Venetian / First Floor (in Casino).

EBSX5DzDMELmPAYfD7miGg.text: Great noodles here. Fried shrimp noodles were declicious, especially the shrimp. The beef broth and the seafood broth noodles were really good. Skip the appetizers cause they're average and lack flavor. Also the noodles will fill you up.

E8vMIZMP-ElrJTyLCIPddg.text: Noodles soups are really delicious and authentic. The appetizers are so so. The spicy cucumber salad we had wasn't that fresh and lack of flavor.

U7i8nlEqZDnk9lJ3AA00kw.text: Very disappointing...had BBQ pork and duck...both were SUPER tough and chewy...pork sauce  overly sweet and duck mostly bone...red hot wonton were no better...just SO SO salty ...not very spicy...bok choy looked 5 hours old...pass on this one...

9Lhcy1GJdaKhKl5Of9SnZw.text: Service was awesome,  fast and consistent. food was delicious. They have different types of Asian food that what makes it unique .

Wyx-80jjBdQqiVl6LmxTJw.text: Oh god.  I was craving some noodles or carbs, but felt worse after eating this.  Good: - beef noodle  Bad: - fu chow fried rice: bad sauce. bad ingredients. yuck yuck yuck.  they ruined my fave fried rice. - red wontons: way too soft. overcooked.  Overall: food: yuck service: rude price: pricey for yucky chinese ambience: think chinese place.  good for groups though!

j866cmRye2w-b32z8A2fvA.text: This place is one of my preferred late night or early morning restaurants. The Singapore noodles dish is amazing. Their wonton soup is absolutely to die for.

PLS7ueTi8mZo-sRsV2aXUA.text: So we came in for a late lunch after a night of hardcore drinking and clubbing. I heard the beef noodle soup was one of the dishes I should try here. The beef was so tender and delicious. The noodles were okay. The soup tasted like there was a lot of msg so of course it was very tasty. I didn't try the other items on the menu. I had the view of all the massive televisions with sports on them so that was a plus. The staff was okay, not too bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tender beef with noodle soup

-daaIgdfey6Zk5fkCLEAsg.text: Gross!   This place is an overpriced Panda Express. I got simple noodles and they managed to mess it up.  The noodles were greasy and mushy with a sick stomach to follow the next day.   With all the other great places to eat at in Vegas don't waste your time at this fast food chain in disguise.

bdzKfXH37uWi1MidXXINQw.text: My wife and I found this place on a late Friday afternoon for lunch. There was about a 20 minute wait to get it but the place was packed (Note: the place is not huge inside).  We ordered 3 appetizers and 2 main noodle dishes. There was so much food we ended up taking 1/2 of the main dishes with us as leftovers. All the noodle dishes were fantastic. Would definitely go back again.

B9xdgWxStCLbN0BR93-xxA.text: This is on of the three Chinese restaurants at Palazzo and Venetian. It is the most unfriendly of all the other restaurants at the property. Mott 32 is a lot better choice.  The service at Noodle Asia was terrible. Our server, Mao, was very rude. The food came late and was not worth the wait. We asked Mao for our meal as some items came first and the other items never came. She rudely replied back to us every time we inquired that we can cancel our order if can't wait for our food. She made us feel like we were being given free food. The food was of poor quality and taste when it finally arrived. It was very salty. In all we were disappointed  with this restaurant.

PGA-1Uu--2HQW_VWTHp86A.text: Very good noodles and dumplings. We got the pan fried noodles with a variety of meat. The noodles had a very nice flavor to them. Yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork fried dumplings
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pan fried noodles

VGc8dkhOd8UDp1VM6gUL-w.text: One of my favorite noodle shops anywhere including those found in Hong Kong. I arrived at about 6:30 pm and surprisingly they were not very busy when I was seated but were about 75% to capacity by the time I left. Noodle Asia is located on the casino floor of the Venetian Hotel and there is usually a line to get in. I think I might have been a little early for any crowds.  I ordered the shrimp shu mai which were now and always have been as good as they can get. Just enough filling to wrapper ration and incredible seasoning.   Then for me the piece de resistance. The dish that I always crave when I am away from Las Vegas and that I crave again the next day after I have it. The Szechuan Beef and Noodle Soup. The broth can be customized to your taste. Anywhere from mild to very spicy. I chose medium. The broth is incredible. So very tasty that I have trouble not finishing it before I eat anything else in the bowl. Then there are the noodles. Fresh, medium thickness. Cooked to the perfect doneness. But the crown jewel of the dish is the beef. Six or seven huge pieces of beef that literally melt in your mouth. The soup is a combination of flavors that is perfect and hard to find so perfectly blended together.  I have been a regular here for many years and my love affair with Noodle Asia continues.

IcDXSV2TxSsvlb3xmWebZQ.text: We tried pineapple shrimp fried rice and it was too good. Also tried miso mushroom soup.

gdLe-srAL-6hQnNuJyRoMw.text: AFTER POKER I WAS HUNGRY so I figured I'd try this place. I sat at the bar and made my selection, which was basically noodles with chicken. The plate came quickly and had a big fat shrimp on it.  Being deathly allergic to shrimp I waved my server over and explained. She then, looking annoyed, basically scolded me and said that I should have told her about my allergy before ordering.  Forgive me, but why in the Sam Hill would I mention an allergy when I'm ordering something I'm not allergic to? Are you kidding me?  And is it ever really a good idea to scold a paying customer? Especially on their first time? And now I have to tip on top of it, right?

cnOrt0XzhDFGlOpDr5sxxQ.text: The best crab rangoons I've ever eaten, followed by amazingly good fried shrimp. While service was a bit slow, the food more than made up for it! Looking forward to coming back again soon.

Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab Rangoon

I ordered the Beef Black Pepper Udon because it looked really good in the picture on Yelp.  My boyfriend ordered the Mongolian Chicken.  His Mongolian Chicken was pretty good, but I thought my udon noodles was too salty.

eQuJNL5G7n6QqItWb5yHjw.text: Their service is a nightmare.  Food is pretty good.  First of all, host girl ignored us.  When we were done eating and got the check, they already filled out the tip amount, and then printed out the receipt with the total amount after the tip. And they circled the tip part on the merchant copy, expecting us to pay tip based on the new amount.  They also crossed out room charge etc.  That is just...pathetic.  They explained because they get a lot of international people and they do this all the time to avoid confusion. And that we obviously looked like it was our first time in American? To them?  That is somewhat understandable, because yes we look Asian, but it was extremely annoying. Very bad customer experience.   It's almost like those waitress girls were jealous me/us. Would not go there again. Dear waitresses at noodle Asia, if you can't be a sufficient waitress, then don't be one........

q3UX_9aClTMHndrPDD195A.text: Noodles, soups, and Chinese cuisine.   The pho special prime and the kimchi seafood udon are both really good if you're looking noodles with soup.  The combination stir fried soft noodle is a great fried noodle dish.  All the "chefs special" dishes ie beef with broccoli, orange chicken etc are surprisingly good.  Open until 3am at the Venetian near the poker room.  The service used to be consistently quick, but it's been a crapshoot recently.

l3Ll8UtTmdJ9kREIVqIEUg.text: This was our munch after partying, we had dim sum that was perfectly made, duck was really good, a little warm for my taste, I like the food really hot. The beef rice noodles were heavenly. My recommendation is to add extra beef. Definitely a really good place to enjoy traditional food

Y-s3RG6qpWtDkjkGPDWuOA.text: I can't speak for the other dishes, but the beef noodle soup here is really good! They have both spicy and non-spicy versions, and the flavor is great for both. This is probably the most authentic Chinese restaurant I've had on the strip. It can be a bit pricy, but it's the strip and everything is pretty overpriced. The wait can get kinda long if you go during meal hours. It's open late though, so if you're looking for some nice hot soup after drinking/clubbing, it's definitely a great option.

TL1133yndHy0kUI2Shs2LQ.text: I will start with.. my older sister has been going here for many years now and always recommended it to me and others.  So since we were celebrating my daughters 21st Birthday this weekend at The Venetian, I knew we had to try it during our 3 day stay.  When we arrived we were rushed to a corner table, given our menus and made to wait for some time.  When ordering, we ordered drinks, appetizers and noodle soup style dishes.  To start we never received both appetizers to begin with.  My daughters appetizer was given to a table right next to our table that sat down at least 15 minutes after us!  So that was our 1st problem.  Our entrees were served and we still didn't receive our appetizers after asking twice about them.  Finally the manager came and apologized and said they will be on the house.  She then walked away and yelled really bad at the staff where we could hear just as many others could.  Which now made us feel awful.  Now on to the worst part of our wonderful experience...  Me and my daughter ordered the same seafood noodle soup.  We ate about 1/3 - 1/2 of our dishes when my daughter noticed something big float up that didn't seem to look like anything that should be there.  Her friend said.. "oh my god!  That's a big worm!"  My daughter didn't want to jump to conclusions since the soup did have calamari and other seafood in it.  Well they took it out with the spoon and put it on the napkin.. and she was sadly right.. it was a worm!  Now we all felt sick!  We called for the manager right away at this point!  She came over and said.. "no worries, your appetizers are on the way, no charge".  Then we told her and showed her what was in the soup!  At this point my daughter had tears in her eyes and just wanted to go!  The manager had the nerve to inspect it at the table and finally said. "Oh, you're right, I'm so very sorry".  And walked fast away with it in a napkin! Wish we would have gotten a picture... but she knew to take it with her, but of course didn't take the bowl it came in!  We had to keep looking at it!  Then a server came and said "no charge for the one soup and appetizers".  Like are you serious!  Of course no charge for that and NO, we don't want a new soup!  We had to tell them we just wanted to leave at this point!    The manager never came back and we just got up and walked out at this point!  The table next to us stopped eating as well when they overheard what happened.  And this restaurant was lucky!  Because we weren't extra loud and didn't make a big show like many others would have done!    I've NEVER had such a bad experience!  And I was a food server for 15+ years!  I've also NEVER seen such poor customer service!  This place should be ashamed on how they treated us!  They had the nerve to even think I was paying for my soup that was the exact same order as my daughters!  Probably made in the same pot in the same dirty kitchen!  The staff needs to get retrained and the prep kitchen needs to be the start of it!    What a nightmare of an experience!!  We ended up not eating even after leaving because just seeing the worm made us all lose our appetites!  Thanks a lot Noodle Asian for a VERY AWFUL EXPERIENCE!!

HJ9mz0wSG0lznHPIFsQPeQ.text: My friends and I dined here around 3 am after the clubs. The food is good for late night. However, we were waiting for an unusual length of time before we were asked for drink orders.. and it wasn't very pact.

oAL7IpZXLeipcsDxRD6lVg.text: I have been here twice and a solid 4 star wonton noodle joint.  I had wonton noodle twice and it is a decent size and good clean flavor (min MSG).  The wonton was properly cooked and noodle was cooked spot on.

wVS2kEKHVl6V70h_3WRhJg.text: Noodle Asia is very accessible as it's on the casino level. It's 3am closing time makes it perfect for a  late night meal. For obvious reasons I would gear towards noodle based dishes such as Hong Kong Won Ton. The dumplings were pretty good but broth was the killer there. The har gow dim sum appetizer is also a classic and must try as well.   It is Vegas but price wise it's going to cost you $30 per person for an app + main.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lCygf-U93hekV8HATZ5nfQ.text: Perfect late night stop in... pho, BBQ pork, lettuce wraps, all on point. Reasonable prices.

Ac7Go83gLtGzgRmJ1pPrgg.text: Went here for lunch on a Sunday, just before noon.  Waited 15 min to be seated. (5 for the hostess to show up, 10 for someone to clear off one of the many open tables).  When trying to order, was informed that they were out of dumplings. (??) So just ordered the Dan Dan noodles (listed under the wok fried noodle section of the menu) and got a bowl of noodles in water with some sauce and meat. If there had been no water, it might have been good, but instead was bland and almost flavorless. The waitress was nice enough to replace with another dish, the Shanghai rice cakes. They were passable, but loaded with mushrooms (not on the description). My wife ordered the seafood congee and enjoyed it   All in all a slightly disappointing experience.

jA9gIa3hMpGJJjS3gqSUCw.text: For asian food, this place is mad expensive. You'll see a small selection of asian staples that you would normally see at any dimsum place but here the prices have been jacked up.  Of course you would expect it that way since it is located inside a casino in Las Vegas. So its not a surprise. The food was good, nothing mind blowing or special.  Just average chinese food without a twist. LOL.  I mean that in a very sarcastic way.  I still give this place a 4 star only because their food wasn't bad, but the service could be a tad bit better. The servers don't smile, it takes forever to get my water filled and I'm not sure they are that happy. Who knows. Expect to pay around $8-10 USD for a 4pc dimsum item.  I feel like you can probably get something better off the strip and a whole lot cheaper that are normal dimsum pricing.  Again, just note, don't expect much ... this is inside a casino therefore the prices are sort of expected.

yxffgUsBPAsLsdhmOz7uzw.text: Noodle Asia had pretty fast service and decent food, though we found it slightly odd that my husband's noodle dish with seafood came out several minutes before the vegetable fried rice.  The location is either great or horrible, depending on his you look at it, since it's partially open to The Venetian's casino floor. So if you want a quick bite while still having a view to the action, it's great. If you wanted a quiet, more intimate meal, you really should go elsewhere.

9WczDtf-WJwRX517x7VdBw.text: Loved the rice and the chicken dishes. Would like to try again. Nice restaurant located in venetian

kmGJiEAdFgwUUhAKsX5RKA.text: Amidst the sea of highly acclaimed restaurants on the Vegas strip, this casual place is still a must for me with every visit to Vegas despite its average Yelp rating. In between all the fine dining, it's nice being able to escape from the Vegas bustle by not having to leave the Strip and cozy up to simple nostalgic home dishes.  Szechwan beef soup is a traditional favorite of mine with the broth having the right amount of spice flavor and heat. The beef is tender and the noodles are on point being chewy and soft.   The fish filet congee is another comfort food. The fish is delicate and congee is cooked well. Personally, I wish there was more fish and this requires a couple dashes of salt, but after doing so at the table, it is perfect.  Unlike typical Chinese restaurants, traditional Chinese cooking at home doesn't drown the dish with oils, sauce, and salt which is why Noodle Asia brings such comfort to me.

fE953v_wyu4lGIMQEkkHEw.text: SiChuan beef noodle soup on the strip, quite expensive but it's pretty delicious if you're craving warm soup on the strip (located in the Venetian).   Yes:  - Get combo fried rice! - Beef Noodle Soup... spicy, pretty nice and generous chunks of beef and tendon. We also appreciate that the soup wasn't oily.   No:  - Obviously overpriced, double the price of Asian food in LA/off the strip - Service was kinda wack... they charged an extra curry sauce item on our receipt, we complained, and then they informed us that they FORGOT to charge us a dollar for extra Chinese sausage in our fried rice so we actually owe more.... blahblahblah typical attitude.    Love you, Vegas. Xo

3FrWzdfkjNqUqLlcMGhuFg.text: 4 stars cuz it's open late and it's rather decent. Some dishes are slightly salty, but seriously good food after partying.lines aren't toooo long. And prices are just right. I like how this place is central to all the major night clubs.

6anmw1E_VzLm4BV34gtKfw.text: I was excited to try their supposedly amazing beef soup, but was extremely disappointed.  The broth was pretty tasteless, the meat was gelatinous, the noodles were undercooked. We also ordered orange chicken. I am not sure how this chicken should taste,  but I didn't like whatever we got: the chicken was dry and heavily breaded, to the point where I thought I was eating deep fried flour and not chicken.   Also,  I understand it is supposed to be a fast food place,  but it was very awkward when we got our soups and had to wait almost 10 minutes for our party member to get his chicken. I don't like eating when somebody at the table still doesn't have their food. Our waiter was polite - the only positive moment...

9mhqcimD0CYvqxzfj_VXnQ.text: This place is great if you are staying at the Palazzo or close by and it's very quick!!! However the pricing is pretty steep ($17 for noodles, 8-9 for appetizers)  The combination noodles were delicious. Wonton soup also good. They serve Pho now. Fried Rice w/chinese sausage, pork dumplings in the spicy sauce were also good. Mongolian beef great, but nothing out of this world. Calamari balls were good, but no sauce was a bit confused how what to eat it with. It was convenient, clean and quick however, not sure i'd want to come here if i'm not a guest at the hotel.

The Szechwan beef bowl was exactly what I was looking for as a late night meal.  My wife had the miso soup which was also above expectations but I don't think I'll ever be able to resist the Szechwan beef.

If you live in LA or anywhere where you have access to good cheap Chinese food, you are just going to complain about the prices here.  I mean ok it's Vegas and it's in the Venetian, but $100 for 4 people at lunch! I could've gotten the same meal at Sam Woo for $30!

sm0-EKkG9Rp2JieXU1QThQ.text: Kind of dirty..  Service all over the place; seemes like the mgr was fussing our waitress and left us waiting a while..  Wonton soup ok, beef schezwan noodle soup ok - Very Spicy  crab rangoons very good; Combo Wok Noodles Good also  thai tea, yuck

RDOVz7du7wjZIOIIyd8Tqg.text: We came here twice during our stay.   Why? Because of the beef noodle soup. Tired, hungry, slightly hungover, and wanting something to satisfy the need of something homey that American food cannot, Noodle Asia was the most appropriate dining opportunity. Plus it was just downstairs in the lobby at the Venetian.  Shitty service, but it didn't matter when we got our bowls. The waitress took our orders and requests, but that was it . We had to ask other waitresses.

Ifv18FuPBdvOI9Pr7mUlfw.text: Located in the Venetian and open till 3am....  Good spot if you're craving Chinese food kinda late, need a quick fix and don't mind shelling out like 14 bucks for fried rice or noodles.  Seems more like quantity over quality here...but eh does the job.  *Yung chow and seafood/bbq pork fried rices were delicious and came in huge portions.  If I ever ate here again I"d just order the fried rice.  *The Szechwan Beef noodle soup that everyone raves about was blah.  Where people drunk when they had this?  I was sober and the broth was blah.  Noodles were kinda soggy. At least the beef was good.  *Mixed seafood pan toasted noodles.  So I was envisioning the yummy pan fried cantonese noodles from PF Chang's when I ordered this.   I was disappointed when the noodles were the thin vermicelli ones.  It def. was toasted on the outside which is fine, but the sauce was pretty flavorless.  Booooring....  * Wonton soup was tasty.  * Mike C. had the roast pork and roast duck with rice combination.  He didn't like the roast duck and thought the roast pork was decent.  I thought his rice with the sauce it came with was delicious though.

uhgCcCbzoS1t4PHGc--LJg.text: Pricey. Like most of Vegas, this place looks and smells great. Food - it hit the spot but I won't wake up in the middle of the night screaming Noodles Asia! like she was some long lost hot lover I wish I had married. _-OVPsaAjArO8kSpFCvB1Q.text: It's not a pleasent experience at this restrant! Food is delious and tasty! The woman with short hair on the reception is very kind! The waiters like robots without any smile especially the cashier' women!

JjRT_UitPi-VF64B6WHtmg.text: Service- excellent. 5 stars for sure! They refilled our waters like 5 times. They were all very polite and attentive.   Food- amazing. Some of the best I've had. Boyfriend got hong kong won ton soup. If I get sick, I will drive from la to get this soup. The broth was so good and flavorful. I got the night market fried rice. Perfect amount of spice. It was sooooo good and soooo big. I couldn't finish it but I wish I could have.   Price- 28 even for two. I think that's average lunch price on the strip. Worth it!  Atmosphere- open and big. Not too crowded. Perfect for a quick bite to eat!

Li6qBkpXcnMGqK5lqnaefw.text: I was badly in need of some noodle soup to cure my hangover and I remember walking past Noodle Asia the night before in the Venetian  Ordered the Szechwan Beef Noodle Soup ($13.95). The broth was quite tasty and hit the spot. The noodles themselves were quite good too. However, the beef was almost inedible. Super tough and there was no easy way to break the beef cubes into manageable bites.  Did it hit the spot? Yes. Would I go back again? Only if I had a hangover.

51torI-eWJrgfd6RdbP7Qw.text: The service was friendly and fast. The environment was spacious. I had the opportunity to try the Szechuan beef noodle soup. It was very flavorful although it costed more than most typical Asian restaurants, but that's the Strip for ya.
