xz8beKy_nJDKVAC7hHOX7A.text: The reviews are kind of all over the place, so not sure what to gather except for our own experiences.  This is a usual place we hit up when in town.  But creatures of habit as we are, we always stick to the same dishes... can't miss right.  And they're always excellent.    Spicy Scezchuan beef soup... it's got some serious kick but so flavorful.  Yes spicy, but with the proper ratio of flavors.    Pai Goo noodles, which is basically a pork chop with noodles... Simple, tasty, and very fresh.  Spicy cucumbers... accompaniment of some fresh veggies.  Congee... all very tasty.  Again, comfort food with great flavors.  All the above tend to be on the somewhat lighter, brothy side.  Would love to try some of the other dishes, like any of the fried noodles.  And yes, as the name implies why wouldn't i?  Well, bc it's all pretty damn greasy and as tasty as that may sound, and as much as i like not having to put on any lip gloss, it's just all way too heavy.  And i think that's where some of the negative reviews might come in.  Service was solid, not 5 star Fancy LV restaurant, but yunno, it's a $13/bowl of noodle level of service.    It is however, clean.  And fast.  Fresh.  Tasty.    So, basically, it's what most of us want in a good chinese restaurant that is unbelievably difficult to find.   Very affordable, fresh, tasty, comfort food, in a clean setting.   Trust me, that ain't easy when it comes to Chinese food.

aBpBQKkRnBk58AnwFyzdlQ.text: Everything on that menu is crafted to perfection. The fried rice is perfect... Aromatic and perfectly spiced. The duck and the noodle dishes are the same. Perfectly spiced and the ingredients are fresh! The chefs are Chinese and are not kidding around. They are pros. Given that finding a decent Chinese place in Vegas is like searching for the Holy Grail, I feel like I've hit the jackpot! How it's Done!

WqUWlJZ8Q68DMk2f1ZJ3zg.text: I ordered the beef rice noodles which were good but too much noodles, too little chewy soft beef and like three stings of sprouts and 3 onion slices.  A little too grease and overpriced.  I guess it would be a good hang over lunch but for the money you can do better.  I would go back if I'm like right there and ready to eat.

ncJObkKE9y0PJaUsWB17fA.text: Pricy but food was not as good as before , we had this 40 year old lady serving us and she didn't do well...gave us the wrong check and went back to blame on the cashier when she was the one grabbing the wrong check..I heard it all..won't go back again

0aWZ1BURv557S2lCxHxnSw.text: Ok, I'm sure the menu as a whole is not 5 stars, but the beef noodle soup, OMG THE BEEF NOODLE SOUP.   I've never even had anything else because frankly, why would I when the beef noodle soup is the best.  EVER.  Thus, the 5 stars.  I've tried several beef noodle soups in the LA area and yeah, a couple are pretty darn good, but they are no NOODLE ASIA GOOD.  The other versions that I've had barely have any heat, Noodle Asia's soup definitely has a spicy kick to it.  Soup isn't too heavy and the beef is very tender.  The noodles are thick, the way I like it.  I like the onions and pickled veggies that comes on top too. I know it's Vegas but too bad it's $13 and the bowl isn't that big.  I want some now!

nBtsTsEpMawCUmWHSphO8A.text: This restaurant in the Venetian had a long line and ridiculous prices but pretty decent food.  We got a bowl of thin egg noodle soup (around $14) with Cantonese dumplings (about 5-6 total) and added crispy roast Duck for another $6.50.  I enjoyed the duck but that made expensive soup way more expensive.  For that price, the duck should've been included.  However it was good and had two thin pieces of Chinese Broccoli.  I ladled it into 3 small bowls so no one was getting full on that.  I also ordered Kim Chee but it was supermarket quality.  Don't bother for nearly $6.  Also got BBQ Pork fried rice.  It was good and the pieces of BBQ pork were nice but I think I would splurge next time and get the 3 meat combo of Roast Duck, BBQ Pork and soya chicken for $23.50.  Many of the tables were ordering the 2-way or 3-way meat combos and they looked delicious.  We ordered a Thai Ice Tea and it was splendid, but for over $40 for just a noodle soup with duck, fried rice, Kim Chee and tea, I would venture off the strip next time and skip this place.

sLuM79aX_tlmCN6BIiuYmA.text: You would think a Chinese restaurant in a casino/hotel would suck, even if it's a 4-star casino/hotel.  But surprisingly Noodle Asia is pretty good.    I eat here almost every time I'm in Sin City.  The noodle soups are a little bland for my taste, but I do like their pan fried noodles and the fried rice.  The dim sum is not bad either.

zIyx0FCkpe38Xit_hD796w.text: Favorite place to watch sports and eat. A tad pricey but this is Vegas. Food is great.

yKgQSGEcIvTOERAiKtMNJw.text: Best Curry Fried Rice ever. I've been dining here for the past 3 years, everytime i visit vegas. The taste and the quality is top-notch.  Conveniently located right next to the poker room.

4neR_ij3zuK57j05UaKeEA.text: It was ok but would not go back. Although the restaurant was not very busy , the service was not the greatest. One of my dishes was not heated through and no one offered any drink refills.  On the plus side the portions were generous. I would not recommend to a friend.

BZT3r_k-SfkzDpntorI3fw.text: Indifferent. I would rather drive to the Asian plaza on Spring Mountain Road. Maybe I ordered something wrong.

gH1_pSlMxm82KoWQeBeiLQ.text: This restaurant is located in the Venetian Hotel, and they serve a variety of noodle, rice, and dim sum dishes.   The price is a bit high, but surprisingly, the food was pretty good. We came here around dinner time, and the service was pretty fast. Noodle soups came out before the dry noodles. I noticed that the dry noodle had more noddles/veggies/meat than the soup kind.  I think they open late, so it would probably make a good late-night meal. I will come back the next time I'm in Vegas.

l97871_OpynOfcq3vaLlYw.text: If you have a craving for some Chinese food, come here. I like this place because it's one of the few Chinese restaurants on the strip that comes kind of close to tasting like it. And the price is reasonable considering where it is. Everytime I come here( I go to vegas 2 to 3 times a year), I've always had fast service. Of course it won't be as good as the restautants in the SF Bay Area though.  I know they have some other 'non-Chinese' things here like sake but they have mostly Chinese dishes. This is what I ordered the last time I was there:  Hot and Sour Soup(kind of spicy but I like spicy) Red Won Tons(kind of plain but not bad) Spicy Beef Tripe(this was good although I wish it warm, didn't know it was a cold dish) Si Jiu Beef(this was good)

RR1TX2mCMeQhrjKHUsl8tw.text: I've never been disappointed with anything I've ordered from here.  In my most recent trip this past weekend i had the Wonton Noodle Soup with BBQ Pork and shared dumplings with my cousins.  The dumplings were delicious and it's actually fried on all sides not just one side.  The noodle soup was tasty and they actually put a good amount of veggies.  The service is fast and this restaurant is a little tucked away next to the sports book.  You can also order room service from Noodle Asia but it's not as good.  Or at least the noodle soup isn't.

qjq_8kcmo1JPQ_NMs69wlw.text: Food all tastes the same. Dan Dan noodles taste like they got some dan dan noodle paste from the store and put peanut butter in it. The waitress spilled soup and continued to spill it all over even after we alerted her. She got this all over my white shirt. No tip for you.

tcZB9mEDnRPiygoDWQdnfA.text: My favorite place to eat in Vegas. The BBQ pork fried rice is amazing and I love the crab Rangoon & pot stickers/dumplings. It is right next to the Venetian sports book

P3f1pf2DcJp3jFcd9zbEAA.text: This place had me hypnotized. There are 30 restaurants in the Venetian and I had my first 3 meals here. I'm not a Chinese food or noodle freak. I just really liked the food, either that or they got me hooked on MSG or something. Whatever I was, I couldn't take my palette off them for 2 days and I will be searching for food of similar quality back in Philly. I've decided to check Chinatown since I think it's likely there are a few Chinese restaurants there.

IVEL7v830sh_pYKUTmL14Q.text: I arrived into Vegas on a later flight on a FR night so it was like 2:00 AM before I even got to my hotel on the strip.  Of course flying in from the east coast, I was starving as I'm not a fan of most airport food unless I have no alternatives.  I Yelped around for what might be open and I wanted something on the light side as I was exhausted and heading to bed after this.   Hmmm, what's open at 02:00 AM, and servers light food and was close to my location - Noodle Asia fit the bill.   I walked up at 02:00 and was prompted greeted and seated.  I got a good feeling when there were quite a few Asian patrons who seemed like they were having a great meal present.  The place was not full, though not as empty as I expected for 02:00, but hey, this is Vegas.   Given I wanted to eat light, I had a bowl of soup -  Miso with Enoki Mushrooms Soup and a bowl of steamed Edamame.  The Edamame arrived quickly and had a nice scent of 5 spice and was salted perfectly.  they hit the spot while I waited for my soup to arrive!   The Miso was a great blend and adding the Enoki Mushrooms gave it just the right added texture and substance I was hoping for a lighter meal.    They also had quite a few other noodle soups, rice dishes, wok noodles, and appetizers.  I did not see anything on the menu which looked outrageously priced - especially give you are in the Venetian!  In fact, given the quantity of food I received, these prices were in line with what I've had in San Francisco and other larger cities in similar locations.   My meal came to $13.  I was VERY pleased!  I will be trying to go back before I leave but if not, I will return the next time I'm in Vegas!

7tkygpHMelBrj9sucRDJhg.text: My favorite place for hot schezwan soup.  $18 is a lot to pay for a bowl of soup but this is worth it.

7rOoqvoPXBCmFBuLpet27A.text: I remember this place 2 years ago when it was an overpriced, greasy sandwich/American grill place.  Now that it's a Chinese restaurant, it's a total upgrade than what it was before.  The place is small and doesn't have many tables.  We were lucky enough to get in before the lunch rush.  By the time we ordered our food, there was a long line and people were waiting for tables.  The food here is delicious!!!  A bit pricey, but what do you expect from Vegas and the Venetian?  Dishes were in the $10-18 range, when you can get it at home for about half the price.  (Chicken chow mein was about $13-15).  We had lunch for 4 people and ordered Fried Rice, Chow Mein, beef tripe appetizers and spicy garlic chicken wings.  This was the best chow mein I ever had.  The noodles tasted soooo fresh and delicious.  It wasn't salty and the onions were cooked al dente (the way I like it).  The fried rice was also delicious.  It was fresh and wasn't greasy.  The spicy chicken wings were topped with fried jalapenos and garlic.... OMG! Flavor explosion!  This place is pretty authentic.  None of that Panda Express, PF Chang's bullsh*t here.  I love that you can see the Chinese cooks inside the kitchen!  There was lots of steam and yelling back there, but I loved it! Hahaha..    Noodle Asia gets 5 stars because it's right off on the casino floor and a few feet from the penny slots.  While we were waiting for our food, I stepped out of the restaurant to play some penny slots for a bit.  A minute into playing, I won $60 on the penny slots!

8853Jr9bNNh2dEoD7R75HA.text: Late night snack place.   It hit the spot and we both had happy plates. I'd go again if I needed a quick bite to soak up all the alcohol or to fight off the lack of sleep.

_5zcwzW1luT3FNInYPoERA.text: We ate here on Sunday night around 2am.  Perfect timing, as they are open til 3am. We partied at XS @ Encore and walked back towards the Venetian just to have some chinese grub, instead of taking the taxi to chinatown back/forth for the same amount of dough.  Had the porridge dish as well as the fried chicken wings & also the szechwan beef noodle soup and singapore fried noodle.   Sounds like alot of food for the 3 of us, but it was actually pretty good to cure the buzz and the quality wasn't bad for casino chinese food.  Only gripe was, the porridge was lukewarm and they promptly took it back and heated it up nicely for us.  Worth a shot if you just want some quick chinese food and are near the Venetian.

XRJOdaL9g9UH4vhOy2EQKA.text: Came here with a friend yesterday ordered 5 plates of food and it still came out to about 37 dollars Considering it's inside the casinoit's an amazing dealThe food took a while to come out but it was busy so I understandGreat place, it's the place to go eat after partying or just out and about and still won't break the bank. The food is great too!

eYINarcMy6H8W2qSPOo70Q.text: Convenient location in the Venetian Hotel, That's about the only positive thing one can say about this place. Both my visits here have been the same. Average to poor Chinese food, rushed service. Yes it's convenient, that's why I ate here, but I don't think, 3rd time, will be the charm.  Our Chinese Broccoli came out 1st, almost 10 minutes before the rest of our food. Dim sum Shui Mai was was so so, Dan Dan noodles were really disappointing. We paid the bill and still had a half beer to finish, they really wanted to turn our table and rush us out. At least it's not the Americanized Chinese food you get at some places for those who don't know any better.

esfydFtM9qK8Pe9zxSmoBg.text: Good place for a midnight run.  We went when they were almost closing, so all the chairs were stacked on the tables ready to close, but we asked if they were still open, they invited us in and pulled down a few chairs and put a few tables together for us.  The beef noodle soup is a definite must-get when you're hungry at 2 in the morning .  It was really good, but if you're not into the spicy, then I guess you'll miss out on it.  The other stuff was just average Chinese food, but good nonetheless.   Of course this place would be pricey though, it's Vegas!  Anyway, if ever you need some food after partying it up at Thao, come here!

EGu0T0DKhrOKSIx2891j2A.text: After a night of clubbing at Tao, we made a pit stop here to satisfy our late night hunger. We got seated immediately and our seats were right by the entrance. I think my friend and I shared a bowl of BBQ Pork and Roast Duck Noodle Soup while the 6 of us shared Dim Sum (Har Gow and Siu Mai). Each Dim Sum came with 6 pieces each so it was perfect. They were very accommodating and the food was pretty good. When it came time to pay, my friend and I wanted to pay for the birthday girl's share. I wasn't provided a receipt after paying so I went to ask for one because the birthday girl kept asking (wondering why no one took her credit card). All in all, not bad for my first time here.

rpNI90PlXTk1Cqg0sOSzng.text: this place definitely has the best asian food in all of vegas! and what better way to top off your night after clubbing at tao then to have some noodles at noodle asia??  i've been here about 4 times, couple times drunk and tired after clubbing, and another couple times the morning after...hungover and looking for a hot brothy soup to wake me up.  the Szechwan Beef Noodle Soup is my favorite. the broth is flavorful and kinda tangy.. and the fried rice here is good too. the beef rice noodles are a good choice too if your not really in the mood to drink soup.  obviously this isnt gonna be the best noodle house out there, but its pretty dang good considering its in a vegas hotel, on the strip, in the middle of nowhere, in nevada.

fVOFjlVGkYp1-7t9tQOfdA.text: One of the best Chinese noodle houses I have found on the strip. I've been to Hong Kong and China over a dozen tines and I really think that Noodle Asia tastes very authentic. I love Chinese food.....real Chinese food...there is a big difference between Chinese food in China and what we get here unless you are Chinese and in the know of the secrect spots....which I am not. I love the noodle soup with bbq pork and duck! Service is not always prompt but the food makes up for it.  Whatever you do, do not eat at the Noodles in Mandalay.....that can scar you for life or at the least turn you off to chinese / Thai / east asian food.

G9VrEWWlIqjhHHroNshgTA.text: Last Sunday evening, I went there alone and was seated immediately at the bar. No one was at the bar and they were not crazily busy at that time. 5 minutes later, still no one to take my order or offer me anything. Then a Caucasian couple sat at one end of the bar, they got their orders almost immediately. A few minutes later, 2 more Caucasian couples sat at the other end of the bar, they got their orders almost right away. Then the same waitress came over to take my order with an attitude. Got my water and waited. While the 1st couple almost finished their food, My appetizer just arrived. Another Caucasian sat next to me, got his order right away, while I continued to wait for my entree. Almost every one at the bar was done with their meals and left, my entree was still no where to find. I flagged down the manager and started to say "I was the 1st one to arrive..." The manager could not wait for me to finish my statement and said she'd check. No apologies, no nothing. She went through a big pile of order tickets to dig out my order. Then I still had to wait for another 5 minutes to get my entree. Guess what, it was burnt. I picked through unburnt pieces, paid with a 20% tip and left.

9adPHzfw6C2soCQ7AMgDDw.text: Absolutely fantastic beef soup....and the sauce for the potstickers....wow!

pmgqn4AKyR31etmDqsIhOQ.text: Had the chicken congee -- nothing special, but got the job done. For a (relatively) inexpensive meal on the strip, go here. Conversely, to have your Asian cheapness offended by a mediocre $15 bowl of noodles, go here.

JROgOYXzx43DxFIV_yKjXA.text: Wife loves the schezuan beef soup and fried rice. Good Chinese food that's somewhat authentic. Price is somewhat steep $35 for noodle soup and fried rice.

ohvb6Fyf3d4OK-5Lfm4BBQ.text: Ahhhh  chinese noodle soup after a long night of drinking and partying, this is always the cure all for the next morning headache.  I have tried something different each time and so far I like the Night Market fried rice, Szechuan Beef soup, and the Spicy rice noodle soup. You don't have to go off the strip into China town for a good bowl of asian soup.  I look forward to waking up and walking from Palazzo to have some noodle soup while hung over.

_UcxLUNW_7Fn_RXhhKnFQg.text: We wanted a light dinner before we hit the road out of Vegas and while this was a perfect git the fried rice wasn't anything to write home about but the Vegetable "medley" soup my wife ordered was pretty good. Service was slow and drinks never go refilled but it was relatively cheap food and fit the bill.

PafIOW7EzQltgP2env1XWQ.text: roast duck and bbq pork noodle soup! the noodles, duck and pork are average, but damn, that broth, it is magical. no other bowl of soup on the  strip can cure a hangover like this bowl can. it is a lil pricy though.  too bad they're not 24hrs. dont know how many times we drunkenly pass by the spot at 5am in the morning wishin it was.

6oBGCfURGWdUiGcSkIU73A.text: I had the Pho here and for the price-taste ratio for the Pho. It's terrible. If it was cheaper, it would be better. Then again, it's the Venetian. Everything is expensive. I would stay away from this place unless you love spending money for overpriced food.

dlrMO_vTp4lbA9M_ur1qjg.text: One of the best noodle houses on the strip.  Great for hangovers.  I love the wonton soup they have.  Always a line to get in so get there early.  (and since it's next to the sports bar...you can also catch some ball on the tube)

Mi0ybrJeozbSjQDBVZyCQg.text: beef noodle soup is surprisingly good but waaaay to expensive for this kind of food.  You cant really complain since you are out in the desert though.

538fqX94_aeY3DMCfSiiGw.text: It was not bad for chinese food on the strip. I was feeling a little sick from my trip so I ordered the seafood congee and a side of chinese broccoli with oyster sauce. The soup was good and helped with my congested sinus and I felt a lot better after eating. Prices was fair too considering it was inside the venetian hotel.

TBgqISu8KRbae2vkyhzPHA.text: I thought this place was fine for lunch time or late at night. You go here to eat, not for any ambience (after all, the sports bar with huge TV screens is right by, complete with screaming fans & on the other side is the casino floor). I agree with others who enjoyed the spicy Szechwan (sp?) beef noodle soup. I don't usually like star anise flavoring, but they did a great job with the broth, definitely slurp-worthy.  The other dish was pan-fried noodles with seafood, which was generic in a good solid way. Nothing to rave about, but tasty. You might try topping it off with the red vinegar and some chili sauce to give it some kick. We also tried the potstickers and the shu mai. I liked the filling for the potstickers, but the shu mai I thought was just so-so. The service was fine, but I got the sense that the management doesn't necessarily stress the usual tenets of customer service in the "American" sense, so I'm not surprised by some of the complaints recorded in other reviews. Overall, definitely worth a try if you are at the Venetian and want to try the beef noodle soup for lunch!

iKZGKDGiwJYG6szJoRbwtQ.text: My family and I made the trek to Venetian last week just to eat at Noodle Asia. My wife and I love the Dan Dan noodles and the BBQ pork & roasted duck. But on this trip, Noodle Asia was closed by the local health inspectors for a violation. Very disappointed.

LAKMsZ8ZT3HRm9NlGkIdpQ.text: To my surprise, the food is not bad. The spicy beef noodle soup is pretty darn good, and so is the fried rice. My only complaint is the price, $13 for a bowl of noodles! I guess that's the price you pay for the convenience. I would imagine their rent's not cheap.

bLBIeuwuVFQpJhyyZ3F3xg.text: Food wise was good but small portion.  Other than that I nor my family will NOT come back here again due to bad customer service we received from Iris Xu, our server.  She needs to gain retraining on customer service.  It was our first time eating at the restaurant and we weren't aware of the portion sizes there so shortly after she took our order she remarks, "That's it?  It's not enough."  That comment make its seem like you guys look like you eat a lot so order more.  Instead, she should have said, "Our portion sizes here are small and I suggest you make one or two more orders and I recommend...."  Sure enough when the food came and we ate all of it and it wasn't enough so we had placed two more order but we placed our orders from a different server.  Who knew that team work does not exist with Iris Xu because right before we received our last order she comes at our table asking who took our order and said "next time order from her."  She should have thanked her fellow coworker for helping out during the busy time instead of getting upset.  All I know is that we will NOT be returning back to eat there and I will be spreading the word here in San Diego about my bad experience with them.

qxQgoQrk1DNFbMtggjFvdQ.text: Order: the sechuan beef, or beef noodle soup. its amazingg. Any of the noodle soups are just great. The cantonese sausage fried rice, made me a believer in chinese sausage. that speaks for itself  Don't order: dumplings, protein dishes like mongolian beef  I HAVE to eat at this place every time I go to Vegas. 'nuff said

7cV9aFgEAFo7kgJIcPpHtA.text: I have been here a few times and have ordered the wonton noodle soup and the schezuan beef noodle soup.  The food is not bad, but for the price I think there are better alternatives in Chinatown.  Service is OK and the ambiance is more like a cafeteria feel.  A good place for a fast lunch, but not a nice place to dine with friends or for a special occasion.

GavqY9dmV4RvPVsGZ24Afw.text: Decent food.  Fast, prompt service by the staff that are not very friendly or accommodating.  Overall, decent value.  Mongolian beef was good, pasta with shrimp was fair, duck breast was good.  Well worth a visit.

p1QnBJaZvE9JmNk4C3kdxQ.text: Its open 24 hours and they have a good selection of Asian food for a reasonable price considering it's inside the Venetian.  I had the beef noodle soup and it was delicious

8GwGJeA2D3fXzrAzmySUXA.text: One of my favorites on the strip! If you want a good bowl of PHO this is the place. Good prices and very fast on serving.

1QT-szhWcJGWE67SU0Q4sg.text: Our absolute favorite Chinese food in any city we have been to. The dipping sauce for the gyoza is amazing! I get orange chicken and LOVE it and hubby can't get enough of the kung pao chicken. Their chicken is such high quality- no disgusting fatty pieces. Well worth the money. We don't visit Vegas without eating here.

Uvhkn4dEb07epp8p9MoGFQ.text: Very tasty. Clean and fast. I ate too much. Only cause I had half of my wife's dinner.  Pot stickers are a very good starter.

oUcpZo1Zl9Zj28xb7CMufQ.text: The food was excellent!  I ordered the BBQ pork rice dish, and it felt like I was in HK.  The price was decent compared to the more expensive ones at other 5* hotels on the strip.

VBZgcj5jHfqeqTxGDhjKlw.text: I'll start by saying AMAZING food! yes, this place is very convenient since it is right in the casino floor of the Venetian. We were in Vegas for 4 nights and I think i ate here 3 or 4 times during that stay. I love authentic Asian food and their black egg congee reminds me just of my mom use to make. Another thing I love was their kim-chee, sounds weird, but their kim-chee was just perfectly enough sour that all my Korean friends that went with me was extremely ecstatic. One of the times I tried their duck noodle soup and it was flavorful and the egg noddles was cooked just right. I highly recommend!

S_IGSqNPPoNfxyKxUXFSeQ.text: This is an automatic stop for family every-time we are staying at the Palazzo.  We come here for lunch or a quick hot noodles fix after a late night drinking. Their noodle  soup are very tasty and delicious which always hit the spot.  Love the fact they close late at 3am.  This was our first stop after checking in the hotel so will definitely be back after drinking tonight.  They also have Pho but soup base seems a watered down and not the best out there.  Some of my favorites includes Shrimp Fried Rice, Beef Congee and the Duck Noodle Soup.

8Uu-Rx1xH9dwUdF8iv-sRg.text: This place is good however it is quite pricey for Chinese food. But hey you are in Vegas and this place is located in the Venetian so what do you expect right? I have been here several times and have ordered several dishes which were quite good and satisfying. The 3 stars is because of the price ( which I know I can't get for cheaper in SF) and the so-so service.

zzOELksi2Zn1L26XKG1SWw.text: Used to come here a lot and always found the food to be good but the service to be horrible.  Lo and behold, they listened to the complaints and really upped the service to beyond good, it's actually amazing.    Great food, great service.  Didn't give it 5 stars because it's expensive.

INk_J8-VbwcDSAuXj7YpCA.text: Had reservations at 1015 pm.  Late by 15 minutes.  Waited 2 hours after that.  Sounds more of a night club than a restaurant.  I was the fool.

qiPU0AqMv6Dxp4QpAzTDQw.text: Review is purely on the food because this is just standard quick casino fare and the venue is hard to find on the Venetian casino floor.  Had the beef noodle soup.  I'm not chinese so not an expert but the noodles were hand made and soup was delicious.  I would recommend you try this dish.  Also tried the seafood pan fried noodles which were excellent as well, some of the best I've had in awhile.  We also had the siu mai which were passable.    Overpriced for what it is but if you're gambling at the Venetian and you want some noodles, I would try this over the crap pizza and sandwiches they have at the other end of the casino.

QWhCwPdF0CpcH4WhaQ83gw.text: Great Hong Kong Cuisine at prices that are in line with being inside the Venetian. The stars here are the Cantonese Sausage Fried Rice, Pork and Preserved Egg Congee, Wonton Noodle Soup, and steamed soup. Service is also in line with Hong Kong casual dining-bearable. Love the late night hours, open until 3 am. Great supper place while staying out late! Prices are not as high as Noodles in Bellagio and food is way more authentic!

pWqbSZMUdJMttKJZVAdwCw.text: Bad food and bad service. Don't get the pho. It is flavorless and overpriced. That's typical of most pho on the strip, but I was desperate for some hangover food. Barely ate any of it, but I wouldn't recommend it. Also, the beef noodle soup is the highly recommended dish, but it was disappointing, overly spicy, and I know what good beef noodle soup tastes like! One of my friends got the beef chow fun noodles and it took so long for them to make it, by the time we were almost done eating his dish came it. It was piping hot and greasy, but better than the pho or the beef noodle soup. It's probably safe to say that if I come back, I better be sober and ready for some pan fried stuff to leave satisfied.

sA9cqNP827S9RLOjfpdcOw.text: This place is conveniently located inside The Venetian Casino. We came around 8pm on a saturday evening and it was not packed...yet.  The service was not very good because the guy kept forgetting us and rushing us to order. However, once we got the order placed--the dishes came by super fast.  We ordered: - Chicken/Mushroom Noodle Soup - Chinese Broccoli with Oyster Sauce - Shrimp Dumplings - Hot and Sour Soup - Cold Jelly Fish Side dish  The Chicken/Mushroom soup came in a nice portion sized bowl and it was not cheap. My dad said the flavor was good , but my mom preferred my hot and sour soup better. There were lots of chicken and mushroom bits in the soup and it was hot (temperature).   The Chinese broccoli was excellent, the sauce wasn't generously drizzled on the broccoli which we preferred. The dish was a hit and i would've ordered that again if i came the next time.  The Shrimp dumpling (dim sum) was good, but not worth the price. It came lukewarm or not even warm. The dumplings were sticking with each other. but, nonetheless it was food.   Hot and sour soup was a hit for my mom and I. I liked it , there were lots of flavor and it gave a kick (spicyness).  I would order this again, but for 5 bucks for a cup is SUPER EXPENSIVE. the cup was not a big cup..so get a bowl if you're hungry.   the jelly fish was a slight dissapoint out of all the dishes we tried. It lacked flavor and it wasn't as crunchy as I would have liked it.   Overall, we had a good experience, it's legit chinese food that I missed while staying at LV. Definitely not like LA , but its vegas and food is not cheap. I still would come back and try their spicy beef noodle soup. yum!

0yNOYMUQogqIzzj3KRgWnw.text: Very Clean.  Nice service. Variety of selections on their menu.  I had the Szechuan Beef Noodle Bowl and Mike Desort had Pork and Roast Duck Noodle Bowl.  Why does other people's order always look better...?  I couldn't resist...I had to grab some from him...I was enjoying Beef Bowl, but I couldn't keep my eyes off his order... I would definitely come here again.  The price was reasonable...

Vnn7jXBbyQgqsMjqt0HyDQ.text: It was late at night and the girls and I were hungry. I ordered won ton noodle soup and it was sooooo good. I don't know if it was because I was a little buzzed or I was super hungry, but it was freaking delicious.

Yuqf5-w9ZFu5peyqrhjblA.text: Meh.....just meh.  Good sized portions, but average tasting. Chicken lettuce ($13) wraps were pretty yummy. Black peppered beef udon ($15), wok tossed, had a strange taste so had to send it back. Mongolian beef ($16) I would not order again.   Service was somewhat slow, had to ask one waiter who had to ask another waiter to get our waiter when we needed something. Had to ask for refills. Had to ask for bill.   If your hungry and dont have high expectations this is your place.

zBAbsDZ7LugOGSeGdqOZ7Q.text: The food is passable, though the portions for an entree could be more filling. Right on the casino floor, so the smell of cigarette smoke floats into the restaurant. Service was good and food arrived quickly.

q-sOJea2WJ9A1XjumpONfw.text: One of the best Chinese restaurant I ever had at Vegas. The atmosphere of the was very clean and the server was very nice and very polite. If I ever was at Vegas I would definitely go to that restaurant and eat their foods again. Excellent excellent excellent

kRNsvtitj8QKlAOdZtz5JA.text: Great food! Polite staff!  Our order came out fast. My husband had the Szechuan beef soup.  The beef was super tender, like ribs or pot roast and very flavorful.  I  The potstickers were homemade and delicious!  Larger than normal and the dipping sauce was outstanding.   Kimchee was great and a very large portion.  I had wonton noodle soup dish and it was good and filling.  Tea was great...water glasses were always full.  Coincidently located in the Venetian.  No complaints at all!  Great place to fill your belly before gambling!

Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Giant pot stickers
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kimchee yum!!!

Xu68J8YQUlaV0qR6PrThlQ.text: My friend and I was looking for some Asian food; I knew this place was good from a previous visit I had. I ordered the egg noodle with wonton! So flavorful!!   I would definitely come back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pho
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg noodle with wontons

8-6gH9i9laEJWmOzxL-cdw.text: Soups are Amazing! Tried the chicken noodle vegetable and the Hong king noodle (ask for udon or thicker noodle) great flavor great broth. Combination fried rice was on point. Definitely the go to after a long night out in Vegas.

twemQsv_tvMj9zOjLrpvww.text: Don't be fooled by the number of reviews this place has, it's not worth it to come here!!   Came here in hopes of finding a good noodle spot to try.  I figured since the restaurant had the word "noodle" in it the noodles had to be good right?? NOPE, this was not the case at all.  We arrived and to our surprise they were able to seat us right away.  They dropped off the menus and were ready to take our order within 1-2 minutes of seating us.  I asked the waitress of any dishes that she would recommend and she said "I'll be right back".  She came back about 5 minutes later and I asked her the same question again.  Her facial response was blank and all she could say was "I cannot give you any recommendations.  Just order what you think you will like"...  We ended up getting the Chicken mushroom ginger noodle soup, shrimp stir fry noodles,  and chicken wings.  Everything was OK.  The stir fry noodles tasted like the instant canton noodles that I ate as a child (an asian version of top ramen) and the wings were over cooked.

wicy5b6tfFdQL6CPeKS0Og.text: 3 stars! Food came out fast.  The curry flavor was good in the singapore mei fun (medium flavor).  There was not a lot of bbq pork in the singapore mei fun dish though.  They had a lot of shrimp in both the plates we had though!  Combination fried rice lack flavor, tasted slightly bland so we made up for it by adding soy sauce.  Overall, decent asian food for decent price in vegas!  Service could have been way better. We came on a summer weekday late after 11pm and it was about 20% filled so it wasn't packed.  Hostess/workers barely acknowledged us.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination Fried Rice
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Mei Fun

m5mwFXmR3E3u8aKA13x7yg.text: Went here for the second time. There are a few saving graces that kept it from getting two stars from me. The first, the crab rangoons. They were awesome. I highly suggest an order of them. Light and crispy, so different than the normal buffet rangoons. The second is that my friend liked his. He got the shrimp and soft noodles.  Now on to mine. I got the vegetable fried rice. First of all, there had to be a three egg omelet in this thing and the egg was very brown. There was no flavor whatsoever. It was just oil. I added a ton of soy sauce and it just didn't help. Terrible. I will not likely go back. Maybe order crab rangoon and take them to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most bland vegetable fried rice I have ever tasted.

-HcK6-DDKC3noJrlBCLzYQ.text: My husband and I came here for lunch. After several days of over eating, we decided to split one of their noodle soups: the Spicy Ying Nan Rice Noodle. We also got the spring rolls which were very crispy and delicious. Neither food item disappointed us, but the noodle soup was my favorite part. The portion size was definately large enough to share.  This was not an extremely spicy soup, but it was tasty. We added a spoonful of the Sriracha they had on the table and the soup became AH-MAY-ZING. The added dimensions the sauce lended to the broth's flavor was unbelievable.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3LiXvVMg7SsbC4biInPRcA.text: Terrible. The server never asked how we were doing he just walked up and said are you ready? we ordered Mongolian beef orange chicken shrimp dumplings and won ton soup everything was terrible except for the fried rice, which we also asked if we could upgrade to and pay extra for and The server responded no we have a side you can pay for? Isn't that The same thing and don't you want to say yes to guests?  The server was rude and transactional as could be . The  wife and I both work for casinos on the strip and both agreed that if we acted this way there would be repercussions. This was my birthday dinner (and we only resorted to this spot because Yardbird was closed for a private event) but the server never cared to ask..

dBmypCSnBI1wd6uGw3dS7w.text: My friend Nay and I were actually super skeptical about eating at an Asian restaurant in Vegas.. especially if its also in a hotel... But was insisted to eat here by Jeffrey that its pretty much best place to go for Asian food in Vegas.   We got seated fairly quickly and was given water and menus. I tried to find something that would help my "hungover-fml-dont-wanna-move" stupor and finally settled on the Szechuan beef noodle soup. The wait for our food was pretty fast and thank the lord for that bc i was starving and at 9pm, it was my first meal of the day ):  The soup itself has a slight kick to it which made it even yummier. The chunks of beef were soft and delicious as well and the noodles were chewy and filling! After inhaling that bowl of soup, it lifted that raging hangover and the "holy shit i wanna die" mentality. THANK YOU FOREVER omg.  My friend got the shrimp fried rice but it was kinda bland but the plate was HUGE  Prices are a bit high for quick chinese food, but i guess its vegas..... Overall will definitely come back here when i wanna kill myself from being hungover and in need of a soup!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Szechuan beef noodle soup

HeTOSvTNIf69T4a35csnaQ.text: The schezhuan beef noodle is sooo good! Dont be fooled by the low yelp rating. This place serves authentic chinese noodle! Hubby got the curry beef noodle and he was also amazed! Great food for capping the night after drinking!

KX_bNn_h5Qsr5NBeDeCwCg.text: Small location, so you have to wait for a table, but it's worth it. The line moves relatively quickly because service is so fast. It's a little "expensive" compared to other Chinese hole in the wall restaurants, but this is in the Venetian in Vegas so duh it's gonna cost more.    BBQ pork and duck over rice - so good! The sauce on the rice is sweet and tasty. Ugh I could eat it over rice every day.  Shanghai rice cakes - yum! The cabbage and pork is cooked perfectly and the soy sauce based sauce is delicious. I love these thicker "noodles" as they're a nice change from the usual mein or fun.   I'm Chinese and love Chinese food, so believe me when I say this place is good and authentic.

Zymo3VZPaYjmMhF2WJ-9_Q.text: I'm afraid to share this place for fear of me having to wait another 40 mins again for my favorite beef noodle soup in America... but I'll happily wait because it's delicious...

i49pWaEiAUC1VpHbQtjEFA.text: 3.5 stars. Among overpriced food in Las Vegas, I am giving this one for 3.5 stars for   - relatively good value comparing to others - fast turnover and service during CES when hundreds of thousands of people descend on the city. Even though the wait was 15 people deep, the wait was 10-15 minutes  I had the Sichuan beef noodles and asked them to add baby boo-Choy as an optional item. It was solid. Not the best bowl of noodles by SF standards but very good by Las Vegas standards. Great flavor. Tasty meat and I would highly recommend a vegetable addition to the soup noodle.   Skip the cucumber appetizer. Not very crunchy by the end of the meal.

MHRAv85N80avaIaZEu1TYQ.text: We were brought someone else's food twice, trash service, trash food. You're better off going to the food court.

mg7RGf19jJZ2lFMdh92o9A.text: How can I be a hipster foodie when there's a generic Asian casino restaurant that I like?   It's expectedly pricey, and for me, the rich beef noodle soup with springy noodles hit some familiar chords in one of my favorite comfort foods.   Not a Vegas expert, but if this was at home in Tennessee, it would really be seriously good eats.

Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I think they did a nice job with this!

UbSe9_yWXRdx1Nfhd0MCLQ.text: Staff Friendly= 1Star Food=0 stars (junk!!) Rock bits seemingly in mapo tofu; all food nearly tasteless, poor poor quality, unclean, no love, no care. Suspect reason for busy-ness= convenient location. Tip: Watch out the customary complimentary tea is NOT complimentary, Tea=$4.50. Waste of food time money. Wouldn't reccommend won't return--Rather starve.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bits of rocks in food.

KhgAk9BjqfOz0pqgLey__w.text: Woohoo! As good as it gets! I had eaten here 3 yrs ago while on a Company trip and this time took the wifey here and once again had an amazing meal wifey ordered the Panfried noodles and Shrimp and I ordered the Chinese Sausage fried rice and they were both absolutely amazing and tasted just deeeelish. I have always loved the concept of the open kitchen and just loved this place. We will most definitely be back as the sign of a great Chinese joint is when you look around and see everyone of the same ethnic background there!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Satisfied customer!
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open kitchen

PuKNBUX0ISGSm-V52QZNTw.text: Expensive but when you've been drankin' all night and you just got to find a place for noodles, you come to the place in which you're staying and find noodles. The place was deserted because likely the price scared people away, but I loved their noodle soup and the husband loved their pan fried noodles. That and the two Thai Iced Teas we ordered almost amounted to $50. Yes, people in Monterey Park laugh at my foolish ass for plunking down that kinda dough on noodles but what can you do? This gal NEEDED noodles.

DV86XqoSKW6r-oivwLn4sg.text: Thank the lawd there's a pho place in the Venetian! Normally my friends and I would go to Treasure Island, but when we saw Noodle Asia not only served pho but also a ton of other dishes we were sold. I'm assuming it's usually not super busy, but I came here during Lunar New Year weekend and it was crazy busy. Luckily people were in and out pretty fast so we didn't wait too long. Service was quick and easy, nothing exceptional. My friends and I all ordered the pho special prime. It's about the same price as the one at Treasure Island $18. They do give a huge serving as well with alot of soup. They do not however give alot of bean sprouts and veggies on the side. I also ordered the fried wings and they were really great! They were crispy and not that spicy. If you ever tried Albertson's zesty wings, it tasted like that.   Overall this is a solid place for Chinese food or pho, and would definitely come back here the next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef pho
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Little bit of bean sprouts

z5W6eKEYHaerSteH_mVS-w.text: This rating is not about the food at all but about the horrible customer service and the extremely rude waitress and her unkindness.  The food can be rated at a four good all greasy, spicy, and fulfilling Asian food after a night of drinking in Vegas or a quick bite for lunch in a casual place.  I have been to Noodle Asia plenty of times over the years and always had the same experience, good food quick bite and good memories. Yesterday however was a completely different story. A HORRIBLE one!!!enough for me to write this review. I have a shellfish allergy, I always have Medication with me for safety and when dinning out I always ask the waitress for info on my meal if in doubt of an ingredient that can send me to the hospital. Last night I order a meal, NOT all ingredients were listed when I selected my meal, I stayed away from all things that can harm my health so noddles and beef.  When my meal came and I had one bite I notice my meal had a sauce, I asked the waitress if the sauce included OYSTER sauce since I know is very popular in the a lot of Asian dishes, she said YES. When I explained to her if it was ok to have my meal prepared again without the sauce she not only got upset but started lecturing me about eating vegetarian rolls because they where made in same oil as some seafood. She was rude, insensitive, and walked away refusing to take my plate back. She left it there for me to eat it, it wasn't until my boyfriend called her back and assured her we would pay for my meal to be made once again that she took my plate and asked the kitchen staff to remake it for me, but not without creating a scene. Not only did I cancel my second order because I felt so embarrassed but other guest got to experience a show, this waitress schooled me about how to take care of my health yet got angry when I was trying take care of it. I left the restaurant, SAD, EMBARRASSED, and HUNGRY. I can say I will never be back to this place.

iKg4eBYeeFVtcMdiYa_oDA.text: This is not a place for dim sum.  It's your neighborhood Cantonese restaurant and great for late night eats.  My favorite is the seafood pan fried noodle (Hong Kong style).  Although I'm not a big fan of fish cakes, the entree had generous portions of shrimps, squid, carrots and bok choy.  The egg noodle was fried perfectly to a crisp. When the translucent white peppered gravy hits the noodles, it's euphoria.  Also, notable entrees are bbq pork and duck noodle soup, any of the fried rice entrees, and walnut shrimp.

0ZHXbGl9o3fuynuTDV1BJA.text: Located at the Venetian Hotel in Las Vegas. Great service, fast or slow depending on how busy it is. I ordered beef/broccoli, chicken chow mein soft noodles, & a small wonton soup. I didn't like the green bell pepper in the chow mein (next time I will order without it). Today, I ordered a noodle soup with chicken and vegetables. Definitely, hit the spot. I added some soy sauce and chili for flavor. One of my favorite chinese restaurants'.

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4JxCweHxk1E_gLweKa1JuQ.text: This place was very, very mediocre. Luckily it wasn't too expensive for Las Vegas, $16 is pretty average for a noodle dish with meat. It was alright, although I did not come in with high expectations basing off previous reviews. I was just starving & really wanted some chow mein. It was a large portion which was great but sort of dry noodles.

p6g0sKtAEEVoNq54S_Udrw.text: 3 of us walked into The Venetian after a show at Wynn looking for food. Wanted to try Black Tap, but the grill top wasn't working :( We saw Noodle Asia, and decided the menu looked really good. Fairly reasonable prices as well for a place on the Strip. I had Singapore Mei Fan; my sister had Miso soup & potstickers; my husband had Hong Kong Wonton soup. We shared Red Won Tons for a starter. WE ALL HIGHLY RECOMMEND THE RED WON TONS!! They have a mild sweet heat in the sauce and the wontons are very well done (there's 8 in an order, if I remember correctly). My sister had no complaints about the Miso soup and potstickers; their potstickers appear deep fried rather than steamed or pan fried and are larger than what you'd expect, about twice the normal size. Both my and my husband's meals were lacking flavor. I ended up pouring the remaining sauce over my Singapore noodles and after that it was quite good. HUGE portions. My husband added soy sauce and chili sauce to his and said it was "ok." Neither of us is particularly eager to return. Pro tip: head west on Spring Mountain Rd for some authentic Asian eats!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Singapore Mei Fan noodles
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potstickers
Photo of Noodle Asia - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hong Kong wonton soup

IXYx91v807qAmELXYT9TWw.text: It was good. He got served quickly (2:30am) we got soup. We liked it very much.  We weren't here during peak time and we pleased with the food.  Keep in mind you are in Vegas. There's more bad food than great. I enjoyed all my soup. It was very good. As did my wife. This was one of the better places we ate at all weekend.  I've read the reviews here and I feel some are over complicated. "I didn't get enough lettuce" c'mon people. This was good soup. There are lots of places to get the high end treatment your reviews were sad about not getting.  1. Our staff that night was very nice.  2. The price was reasonable  3. Our soup was good. We got it fast and was hot and tasty.  There's a lot to be said about timing of your visit. It's True of any place you eat. It's busy things get rushed. Food and service as well as reviews.  You get mad because it's busy and took a while.  Your mad the server was a little short because your b**ching like the other people they're serving.  Eat your soups and go back to the slots Hahahaha  I will eat here again.

LPI0EXbHijclC_DrYRgsmg.text: Noodle Asia is a staple to all my vegas visits.  I've been coming here for over 7 years and the food is always fast and good quality.  Unfortunately the prices have also climbed up pretty high every time I visit as well.  They usually seat pretty fast, try not to come at the super peak times and you'll be alright.   I will usually get some noodle soup and it's well made.  I also love their open kitchen layout which you seldom see in Chinese restaurants.  You can see who is working on your food and their entire workspace!  I guess that helps hurry them up to make food quicker but the quality certainly doesn't lack.  Expect to pay around $20 per person at minimum when you come here.

eRISLmUcDPSB-KSx4_2MKA.text: this is our go-to spot when we are staying in the Venetian because it stays open pretty late - i think til 3am or so... food is decent and service is good - we've pretty much ordered everything on this menu from soup, to duck and rice dishes - you cannot go wrong with comfort Asian food, after a night of drinking or to cure a morning hangover ;) yes this place is pricey but its located in the hotel, so what can you expect - its more for convenience...

ae6DWL5HaHRQXgMjAgU2yA.text: This place is so good that I've been here three times in the four days I've been in Vegas. I had the shrimp with chives twice and the pan fried egg noodles with vegetables. I came here for the 2018 Las Vegas Half Rock N Roll Marathon, and while it wasn't the best choice for pre-race food, I had the shrimp dumplings two hours before getting in the corral. I grew up eating dim sum and this food is worth traveling out of state for!!!  Be advised that because it's awesome, it's also super busy. The tables move fast because of the fast-paced atmosphere, I don't recommend this place to come chill and hang out. Get in, gorge yourself on deliciousness, and get back out there! It's Vegas, baby, Vegas!

qwZRxXKvcvuj3Q-WGHAEJQ.text: Noodle Asia is the perfect restaurant for a hang-over cure or for a late-night-bite (they're open till 3am most nights). The service is fast and the food is tasty.  My BF and I arrived close to midnight and were seated promptly. We were in and out of there in about 30 minutes which is the time-frame we were going for. It's a sit-down restaurant that's quite busy for the most part but they get their food out quick.  When I saw how fast our order came out, I was worried that it was Panda-style, a bunch of pre-made stuff they just heat-up as you arrive. I was pleasantly surprised. The noodles and fried rice we ordered were fresh and very good. Our server was friendly and helpful with the menu. I will return for sure.

yhvMuYywS2cvFsSiUqSINA.text: There's just something comforting and soothing about a hot steaming bowl of noodles whenever you go.  And that was exactly what I was craving so I got the beef noodle soup and it definitely hit the spot!  Also tried the sizzling beef udon noodles which were good as well.  And the fact that they're located right next to the sports book is a huge bonus and the reason why I'll be frequenting here more often!

0B-xSsf3z09UKwXqZpGApQ.text: Noodle Asia over Beijing Noodle!!  We've been coming to Noodle Asia for at least 5 years now and every time we visit, they've always been consistent with their food.  Our order: -Shrimp and Chive Dumplings, fried $8.95 (4 pieces) I'm not a big eater so this usually does it for me. They are very flavorful but BEWARE! They are heavy on the chive! These are especially good when you cut them in half and put them in broth. TRUST ME.  -Hong Kong Won Ton Soup, large bowl $14.95 Personally, I don't care for this, but the BF loves it and it's all he orders when we're here. The broth, however, is really nice and I always make myself a little bowl to put my chive dumplings in.  I don't think the noodles are made fresh, personally. In fact, I don't know if they make anything in-house. I'll definitely ask the next time I'm there.  This place can get super busy since it's a very popular joint! They normally open at 11am during the weekdays and they DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS, so be prepared to wait in line!  4 stars because the prices are inflated, but hey, thats Vegas! LOL

2E_cWAnHjsAHWtjxTIbhiw.text: This is my first time to write a long ass review. If you can't understand my English, pleas skip.   Everything we order are very salty!!!! The chicken wings, the string beans, fried rice. The soy sauce chicken  and duck. And couple entrees.   Is like the salt is free. At the end I specifically tell the waitress please make sure don't make the noodles salty because is for my mom. When our table get cleaned up. When my to go arrived I want to open to taste to make sure not too salty the lady not sure if she is the manager? Or the hostess. She was standing there with her legs open and said out loud in Chinese she think I don't understand Chinese, she said; "what was that suppose mean? What she was doing ? Why she is opening and eat the food? I said: the food is still too salty and my mom can not consume too much sodium  She said: you should have tell me upfront so I can fix everything for u. I said: what do you try to said now? It's my faults? She said: don't u rises your voice and u didn't need to give me bad attitude  I said: you are the one who gave me bad attitude first and what I did to u just to be fair  Then husband tell her we don't want it anymore and I don't need to see her sorry attitude toward to me like these!!! What's going on these day? Ppl doesn't know how to serve ppl right, and if that is the manager is she suppose talking to the customer like these ??? She could have asked in a nice way why I have to open the box and taste it but instead she was bitching at me why.... how's that my fault? I spent $134 for all the salty food without giving waitress any problems but instead I just tell the waitress to make sure not to make it too salty. How's that my fault?? Now I know why you guy have very low reviews because it's the manager who doesn't know how to serve customers right!!! This will be my last to eat here. Will not recommended this place to anyone!!! Booooooo

y-SRV_p34snfW3vuVhJepg.text: I recommend their won ton noodle soup. My other go-to are the combination pan fried noodle or the combination chow fun.

OusSxdjHcS9waBUUe_Z8Sg.text: Horrible service at this place the lady was not hopeful when I ask how bad the meal was and all she said was buy something else and that's it and I'll charge you for it not a great costumer service she did not care what I said please do yourself a favor and not come to this place look at what the served me in pho
